texts.en: The client lives in the Fortín sector.  Need led her to go into this activity and she also got advice and support from her neighbors.  She works alone in her business usually in the afternoon schedule.  She’s unmarried but has two children attending public school.  In future she’d like to buy a vehicle.  She needs the loan now to stock up on pieces of fabric for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has four children.  She is running a business in front of her house, selling slippers, salt, sugar, coffee, milk, Coca-Cola, etc. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she makes sales every day. 

Carlota has been running her business since 2005 with her own working capital. Her husband is a farmer. She is happy with this loan because TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people to improve their  businesses and then their living conditions for the future. Carlota lives in a house that is very simple, and she has many animals  like pigs, goats, sheep and chickens.

loans.use: To buy slippers, salt, sugar, coffee, milk, Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, 'sagiko', beer, cigarettes, water and bread.

loans.name: Rolando Santiago

texts.es: El cliente es de la zona de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás por recomendación de sus vecinos, quienes tenían la necesidad de tener una tienda en el área.  Trabaja todo el día en compañía de su esposa, con quien tiene un hijo pequeño.  Tiene el ideal de poder completar la construcción de su vivienda.  Ahora necesita el crédito para comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y aceite.
texts.en: This client is from the Fortín zone in Guayaquil.  He started some time ago on recommendation of his neighbors who needed to have a store in the area.  He works all day in company of his wife with whom he has a little son.  His hope is to be able to finish building his house.  He needs the loan now to buy food items like rice, sugar and oil.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Angela Paola

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Hace 4 años tuvo la posibilidad de montar este negocio y le gustó mucho, tanto que ahora cuenta con una buena acogida en el lugar.  Trabaja solo, mayormente en el horario de la tarde.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Aspira en un futuro poder instalar un cyber y prosperar con ese negocio también.  Actualmente necesita el préstamo para la compra de material: cartulinas, lápices y cuadernos.
texts.en: This client is from the Fortín sector in Guayaquil.  She was able to set up this business four years ago and liked it very much, so much so that today it’s very well-received in the area.  She works alone mostly during the afternoon shift.  She’s single and has no children.  In future she’d like to open an Internet café and to make progress with that business too.  She currently needs the loan to buy supplies: construction paper, pencils and notebooks.

loans.use: to buy construction paper, notebooks and pencils.

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es: La señora Ruth tiene cuarenta y siete (47) años de edad, vive en el caluroso municipio de Sabanagrande, pueblo ribereño, del departamento del Atlántico, a orillas del Gran Río Magdalena, principal arteria fluvial de Colombia. Reside con su conyugue y tres (3) hijos, dos (2) varones de veinticuatro (24) y veintisiete (27) años de edad, y una joven de veintiun (21) años. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la venta de carnes de res, gaseosas y minutos de celulares. Inició este negocio desde hace diez (10) años, a partir de la iniciativa de su esposo, quien trabajaba en un matadero y le traía carnes para que ella las vendiera. Estas actividades comerciales las ejerce de lunes a domingo, de siete (7) de la mañana a ocho (8) de la noche, compra a los proveedores de contado, y vende a vecinos, amigos y familiares de contado y a crédito. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de carnes, y gaseosas, para atender a su selecta clientela. Con estas inversiones espera mejorar su calidad de vida, y en un futuro cercano adecuar bien su local.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 47-year old woman who lives in the warm municipality of Sabanagrande, a village by the shore of Gran Río Magdalena (main river in Colombia), in the department of Atlántico. She lives with her husband and their three children: two boys aged 24 and 27, and one girl who is 21 years old. She works selling beef meat, sodas and phone calls by minutes. She started this business 10 years ago, thanks to her husband's initiative, who works in a slaughterhouse and brought meat for her to sell. She works Monday through Sunday from 7am to 8pm, buying in cash and selling on credit or in cash to neighbors, family and friends. 

This is her first loan with Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the requested amount to buy meat and soda to serve her selected clientele. She hopes to improve her quality of life and to make improvements her store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy meat and soda to serve her selected clientele.

loans.name: Joe-Ann

texts.en:
Joe-Ann dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman. She runs a grocery business in their village. Joe-Ann started with a small 'sari-sari' store. While running her store, Joe-Ann has learned from her experiences. She used those experiences to continuously improve her 'sari-sari' store, finally improving it into a grocery store.

Joe-Ann's husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker. The couple is blessed with one child who is currently in preschool. Joe-Ann hopes that someday her husband will no longer work abroad thus she is working hard to develop her business and generate more income. 

With that in mind, she desires to access a loan of P50,000 to buy various items like soft drinks, canned goods, fruit and vegetables to sell. She is looking forward to KIVA lenders approving her loan request for it will help her attain her dreams, not only for the business but for her family as well.

loans.use: to buy various items like drinks, canned goods, fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina runs a car hire business in Malindi, Kenya where she also lives. She is married with three children who attend school. Her business has been doing great. This is the only business that the family depends on for a living. 

Sabina has been in the car hire business for the last three years. She heard about Milango through friends at a time when she wanted funding for the business. She now seeks a loan to buy spare parts for the cars. She has a long-term ambition of adding a fleet of vehicles and running a successful car hire business. The challenge that she faces is when customers damage the vehicles and they don’t pay for the damage. Income from the business will improve her living standards and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Fátima Antonia

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven de 26 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos.  Tiene mucha experiencia en el cultivo de maíz, crianza de ganado de repasto  ya que toda su vida se a dedicado a dichas actividad, las que aprendió de sus padres. Hoy las realiza por su propia cuenta junto a su compañero de vida con el cual ya tiene 6 años de estar juntos y han procreado 2 hijos por los cuales seguirán luchando hasta sacarlos adelante

 Viaja unos 1.5 kilómetros  a pie hasta donde toma un autobús o pick up  en el que se tarda unos 25 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad en donde compra los insumos para su cultivo de maíz; luego se regresa pagando un pick up para llevar los insumos para su casa.

El crédito sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, semilla, pesticidas, para cultivar maíz y para cubrir otras necesidades del hogar. 

Gracias al préstamo podrá darle un mejor beneficio a sus cultivos de los  cuales espera tener mejor producción y teniendo mejor producción podrá tener mejores ingresos económicos para su familia y saldar su deuda.

Su plan es construir una vivienda digna en donde pueda vivir con sus 2 hijos y su compañero  de vida.
texts.en:
Fátima is a 26-year old young woman who lives with her partner and has two children. She has a lot of experience in the cultivation of corn and livestock breeding as she has always worked in these activities. She learned them from her parents and today works on her own with her partner. They have been together for six years and have two children, for whom they fight. She walks 1.5km to pick up the bus that takes her to the city in 25 minutes. This is where she buys the inputs to cultivate the corn. 

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to cultivate corn and to cover household expenses. Thanks to this financial support, she will be able to improve the crops and therefore expects to have a better harvest and higher income for her family and to repay the loan. Her plan is to build a decent house to live with her partner and two children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide to cultivate corn and to cover household expenses.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: Doña María, tiene a sus hijos grandes y están estudiando en colegios públicos, ella continua dedicándose a su pequeña pulpería mientras su esposo sale a las calles a taxear de esta manera buscan el pan de cada día. María solicita el crédito para invertir en la pulpería comprando productos como granos básicos, queso, carbón, gaseosas, lo que le garanticen vender diario para mantener sus gastos del hogar.
texts.en: María has six grown-up children who attend public schools. She works in her small grocery store while her husband makes a living with his taxi. María is requesting a loan to invest in her store and buy basic grains, cheese, charcoal and sodas, which will guarantee daily sales to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cheese, charcoal and sodas.

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita has been in the tailoring business for 30 years. She is married with four children. At present, two of her children are working while another one is married and the youngest is still studying. Avelita aims to become a successful entrepreneur someday although she is already at retirement age, so she is doing her best.

Avelita would like to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used in buying cloth and accessories for her tailoring business, specifically for curtains. She hopes for the approval of her requested loan amount for this will greatly help her improve the business she has been with for so long.

loans.use: to buy cloth and accessories for her tailoring business, specifically for curtains.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora, que se esfuerza cada día por brindar a su familia lo mejor. Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años; oficio que aprendió de sus  padres. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposo que se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y cuidarlas; mientras ella se  prepara para ir a  vender frutas y verduras a la ciudad y en la tarde se dirige a la  parcela donde cultivan junto a su esposo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  el abono, la semilla, herbicidas, pago de maquinaria y mano de obra para arar la tierra en donde cultivara. Con la producción de la cosecha, obtendrá buenos ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Ella desea en un futuro construir su vivienda; ya que actualmente esta construida de lamina.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 38-year old woman who is married and has four children. She is a hard-working woman who fights every day to provide her family with the best. She works in agriculture, an activity that she learned from her parents. She gets up at 5am and, while her husband takes care of the cows and milks them, she get ready to go downtown to sell fruits and vegetables. In the afternoon she goes to the piece of land where she and her husband cultivate. 

She is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer, seeds, weed-killer, machinery and labor to work in the land. They expect to obtain good income from the harvest to support the family. Her goal is to build a house in the future, given that their current one is made of layers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, weed-killer, machinery and labor to work in the land where she will cultivate.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 34 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Juana se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, entre otros. Todos estos productos los envía a los caseríos ubicados en las riberas de los ríos y zonas alejadas de la ciudad. Su hermano recibe toda la mercadería y lo vende a los pobladores del lugar. Se inició hace más de 2 años. Cuando no está de viaje, se dedica a la venta de comidas por las noches en el frontis de su casa. Considera rentable sus negocios  por los  ingresos económicos que le generan, los cuales usa para pagar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Antes de iniciarse con ésta actividad sus ingresos económicos no le alcanzaban para solventar las necesidades de sus hijos. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está obteniendo, tiene planes de aumentar el volumen de sus compras. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería variada como arroz, azúcar,leche, fideos, harina, entre otros para venderlos por el río, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al contado.
texts.en:
Juana, 34, is married and the mother of three children with whom she lives in her own house.

Juana earns a living selling food products such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, and others.  She sends all these products to the hamlets located on the banks of the rivers and areas far from the city.  Her brother receives all the merchandise and sells it to residents of the area.  She started more than two years ago.  When she's not traveling she sells food at night in front of her house.

She considers her businesses profitable for the income they generate for her, which she uses to cover the household expenses and her children's education.  Her income wasn't enough to pay for her children's necessities before starting with this job.  Now, seeing the good results she's getting, she plans to increase the volume of her purchases.

Currently she'll request 2000 soles [PEN].  She's very happy to receive some financial support so she can get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount she'll buy a variety of merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta, flour, and other products to sell by the river, trying to get lower prices for her cash purchases.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, pasta, flour, and other merchandise

loans.name: Sari Indah Badung Group

texts.en:
Sari Indah Badung group is getting their new loan from MUK. With 10 members, the total loan is 25,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair cages. 

Ni Nyoman, the head of the group, is using her share of the loan to buy three piglets, pig feed, and to repair the cage. The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from 400,000 - 500,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. Ni Nyoman expects during the loan period the pigs will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream to fix her house.

loans.use: To buy three piglets, pig feed, and to repair the cage

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Myrna has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from 'tricycle' transportation.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old and widowed, with five children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more items, like snack foods, sardines, seasonings, and other groceries.

Norma has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Norma aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like snack foods, sardines, seasonings, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, de 49 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Gladis se dedica a la venta de comidas, todos los días al acercarse la noche instala en la vereda de su casa sus mesas y sillas en donde ofrece a la venta sus deliciosas comidas que son acompañadas con refrescantes bebidas preparados con frutas naturales. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años, Trabaja con ayuda de todos sus hijos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que aparte de tener un tiempo disponible para otras funciones, también le genera muy buenas ganancias económicas, realiza su labor tranquilamente ya que gracias a ello tiene un respaldo económico que le permite enfrentar cualquier situación en la que requiera hacer uso de dinero, le gustaría mucho tener un restaurante en donde tenga más mesas, sillas y atender a muchas mas personas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de ingredientes e insumos como arroz, pollo, aceite, aceitunas y frutas, además de platos y otros utensilios que necesita para brindar una mejor atención.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 49-year old woman who is married and has three children, with whom she lives in her own house. Gladis works selling food. Every night she takes out tables and chairs and offers her delicious dishes and refreshing beverages made with natural fruits. She has been doing this for three years now and counts with the help of her children. She enjoys her job because it gives her time for other tasks and provides her with good income and a financial backup to face unexpected situations. She would like to have a restaurant with more tables and chairs to serve more people. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN and is grateful for the financial support. She will use the requested amount to buy ingredients and inputs, such as rice, chicken, oil, olives and fruits, as well as plates and other utensils to better serve her clients. She commits to repay as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies, such as rice, chicken, oil, olives and fruits, as well as plates and other utensils to provide clients with a better service.

loans.name: Raphaeli

texts.en:
Raphaeli is 42 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. He runs a grocery store in town where he sells vegetables and fruits. He started this business three years ago and he has one employee. He sees his business growing in the next five years. The major challenges in the business include competition from other traders and bad debts. 

Raphaeli knew of Milango Financial Services through a friend and now he seeks a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. He has a plot of land that he plans to develop. The extra income he gets will help him pay school fees for his children and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jose Denis

texts.es: José vive en el barrio El Recreo, una zona marginal de Managua, habita junto a su familia, su hijo quien aun no va a la escuela porque está pequeño, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio y en los quehaceres del hogar en vista de que se le ha hecho difícil encontrar empleo, el siempre dedicado al negocio de venta de productos plásticos desechables en un mercado de Managua, su mayor deseo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio es por eso que solicita el crédito para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y salir adelante.
texts.en: José lives in El Recreo neighborhood, a marginal area in Managua. He lives with his family: his son, who is still young to attend school, and his wife, who helps in the business and takes care of the house as it has been difficult for her to find a job. He has always worked selling plastic products in the Managua market and his biggest dream is to continue investing in his business. He is requesting a loan to improve his income and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy plastic products, such as cups, spoons and plates, among others.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 55 years old and married, with six children.

Elenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sardines, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Elenita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Elenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 43 years old and single.

Nemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Nemia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Nemia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mirella tiene 44 años, y tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela fiscal vive con él y su pareja en el cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Ecuador. En este cantón se puede encontrar varios lugares para visitar como ríos y bosques que son visitados por varios turistas, quienes al coincidir en las fiestas del cantón pueden experimentar las exposiciones de artesanías y las ferias donde se exponen productos agrícolas y también ganado que son animales que conforman la riqueza de muchos habitantes. Estas actividades combinadas con el comercio han dado la oportunidad a la empresa privada para construir hoteles, hosterías y varias ofertas de servicios para turistas. Sin embargo la principal actividad de este pueblo es la agricultura y ganadería que cada año permiten que el índice de rendimiento económico suba cada año a pesar de la poca transferencia de tecnología al lugar. 
Mirella trabajó desde muy joven ayudando a criar animales en su casa. Ahora que vive en la finca de su pareja, ella pudo ocupar un espacio allí para poder criar cerdos que vende al por menor en la feria del pueblo. Invierte varias horas en esta actividad, pero espera poder ampliar los galpones de crianza de los cerdos y llevar un mejor cuidado de cada uno, para poder lograr este objetivo, ella solicita un préstamo con el que espera capitalizar su negocio y así poder cumplir el sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en profesional. 
Mirella se ha unido con personas emprendedoras como ella quienes también quieren ver crecer sus negocios los cuales se asemejan al negocio de ella. Ellos son: Merly de 28 años que vende pollos los fines de semana. Digna de 23 años que también cría cerdos para la venta al por menor y José de 38 años que se dedica tiempo completo a criar pollos para la comercialización al por mayor y menor. 
Juntos han aplicado para el préstamo grupal que Fundación Alternativa les ha dado la oportunidad de obtener gracias a la gestión de Kiva y el apoyo de los inversionistas con quienes están muy agradecidos por creer en la gente trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mirella is a 44-year old woman that lives with her son, who attends school, and her partner in the canton Pedro Vicente Maldonado in the province of Pichincha in Ecuador. There are several touristic places to visit in this canton, such as rivers and forests, as well as craftmanship exhibitions and shows with agricultural products and livestock during their festivity. These activities combined with the trade business have brought the opportunity for private businesses to build hotels, restaurants and other services for tourists. However, agriculture and livestock are the main activities of the canton and allow the economic performance indicator to improve each year despite the limited use of technology in the area. 

Mirella helped to breed animals in her house when she was very young. Now that she lives with her partner, she can use some space in their field to breed pigs and sell them in the canton's tradeshow. She devotes several hours each day to this activity and hopes to expand the storehouses and provide the pigs with a better care. She is requesting a loan to capitalize her business with a goal to see her son becoming a professional. 

Mirella has joined a group of entrepreneurs like herself who work in similar businesses: Merly, 28 years old, sells chickens during the weekends; Digna, 23 years old, breeds pigs for retail sale; and José, 38 years old, works full time breeding chicken for retail and wholesale. Together they have applied and obtained a loan from Fundación Alternativa. They are very grateful to Kiva and lenders for their support.

loans.use: to expand the storehouses for pig breeding.

loans.name: Frezzia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Frezzia es una joven de 22 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Ica. Frezzia es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque quiere en el orgullo de sus padres. Frezzia estudia la carrera de Odontología, se encuentra en el último año de la carrera, y para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios trabaja atendiendo un pequeño consultorio dental por las mañanas; Frezzia cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Frezzia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de estudio, como libros, separatas, materiales quirúrgicos para sus prácticas, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener los materiales necesarios para sus estudios y seguir estudiando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y tener su consultorio propio”.
texts.en:
Frezzia is a 22-year old young woman who lives in the city of Ica. Frezzia is looking forward to get ahead on her own and wants her parents to be proud of her. Frezzia studies her last year of Odontology and works in a dental office in the mornings in order to earn some money and cover her studies expenses. Frezzia thinks she is getting ahead because she is kind to her patients and works hard. 

Frezzia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will buy study materials, such as books and surgical instruments, among others. This way she will have what she needs to continue studying and will be able to make her biggest dream come true: to graduate and to have her own dental office.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 54 years old and married, with 4 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Luzviminda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Kijembe Group

texts.en:
Anton, who is in his early 30s, is married, with two children, a boy and a girl, who are in school. 

For three years now, Anton has been running a retail business, selling fruits and charcoal. He works from 6am to 8pm daily and he is able to make a very good profit per month. 

This will be Anton's fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal and fruits. With the profit received, he managed to buy a plot of land and he paid school fees and household expenses. Anton has successfully repaid all of his previous loans. He will use this loan to buy more local chickens to sell.  He dreams of building a nice family house. 

Anton will share this loan with his loan group, Kijembe Group, which includes 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more local chickens to sell.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras San Rafael Soche Group

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Isaura de estado civil casada, cuenta con 31 años de edad, de escolaridad 6to. primaria tiene 2 hijos y los 2 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cilindros de gas, inició este negocio con un capital de Q.200,000.00 y 15 cilindros de gas, hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia. cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al servicio de mecánico de enderezado y pintura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mas cilindros de diferente tamaño, espera en el futuro que su negocio crezca y estar bien posicionado. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y venta de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Reyna Isaura, 31, is married and has two children, both of whom are attending school.  She completed the sixth grade of elementary school.

She makes a living buying and selling cylinders of gas, a business she started with 200,000 quetzales [GTC] in capital and 15 cylinders.  At present she has seven years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who works as a mechanic in a body and paint shop.

She's organizing a group and requesting a loan to buy more cylinders in various sizes.  She hopes her business will grow in the future.

The other members of the group earn their livings raising animals and selling daily necessity items.

loans.use: to buy gas

loans.name: Jose German

texts.es:
José tiene 20 años de edad es casado con la esposa y con  los hijos viven en la cuidad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla el laurel se encuentras ubicada en el recinto el laurel de la parroquia zapotal nuevo perteneciente al cantón ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol además a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos, con crédito le ayudado a invertir en semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes para los cultivos y en balanceado para los animales.  El crédito es de gran ayuda para aumentar la producción.

El sueño es obtener ingresos económicos e irlos ahorrando ya que con ello puede seguir comprando lo necesario y así obtener la casa y la siembra

Le gusta hacer deporte, estudiar y pasar mas tiempo con mi familia.
texts.en:
José is a 20-year old married man who lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. The "Laurel" communal bank is located in Recinto El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish belonging to the cantón Ventanas and is involved in agriculture. José cultivates corn, rice and beans, and also breeds hens and pigs.

Thanks to the loan, he has bought seeds and fertilizers for the crops and animal feed. The loan has been of great help to increase production. 

His dream is to increase his income and to save money, so that he can keep investing in his land and his house. He enjoys exercising, studying and spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Julia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Julia tiene 22 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Julia se dedica desde a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y frejol.

Solicita el crédito para poder tener capital para la agricultura para la comprar de semillas y fertilizantes, Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a tener un beneficio para la familia.

El sueño es incremetar los cultivos y asi obtener mas ganancias del cultivo.
texts.en:
Julia is a 22-year old woman who lives with her partner and their son in the cantón Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. The communal bank "Luchando Juntos" is located in the Recinto New Zapotal belonging to Ventanas cantón. The majority of its members work in retail. Julia works in agriculture and cultivates corn and beans. 

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to ultimately benefit her family. Her dream is to expand her crops and to obtain more revenue.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Karanjung Indah Group

texts.en:
The Karanjung Indah Group receives their new loan with the same loan amount and the same members. The loan is still used for increasing their pig businesses. Besides purchasing piglets, they will also use the loan to renovate the cages and buy feed.

Ni Komang uses her loan to purchase three superior piglets for fattening. They will be sold five months later. Money for daily needs comes from her husband. Her husband is really happy for that. He supports his wife’s business by maintaining the pigs, feeding and washing the cage every afternoon. Ni Komang and her husband hope the business will be successful for both pigs and her husband's work.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is 38 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family, which consists of eight members. 

Awad has retired from the military and is currently studying for a Bachelor of History since he wasn’t able to study before because of his work. But, with his experience in work, he felt that it is necessary to get the Bachelor degree. He is also planning to expand his studies in the future to get a Master's degree. 

Since Awad is facing a financial crisis, he is asking for a loan to pay for his study fees.

loans.use: to pay for his study fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 42 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family, which consists of four members. 

He is currently studying for a Bachelor of Political Science degree and working at an association. Mohammad wasn’t able to continue his study previously, since he spent his time only on work. But after his experience in work, he decided to continue his study. He is also planning to expand it by getting a Master's degree. 

Mohammad is facing financial crisis, so he is asking for a loan to pay for his study fees.

loans.use: to pay for his study fees.

loans.name: Ferdinan

texts.en:
Ferdinan is a 58-year-old man who is married to Martha, a 55-year-old woman. They are blessed with eight children. Five of them are married and live separately, while another three live with him.

Ferdinan runs a business selling fried cakes. He has been running the business for the past three years. This business enables him to pay for his family's daily needs and school fees. Ferdinan was thinking of producing more cakes and opening a kiosk business. In order to implement his plan, Ferdinan submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of 4,500,000 IDR. This loan assistance will help him to add various items to his kiosk business such as shampoo, detergent, biscuits, candies, wheat flour, cooking oil, instant noodles, etc.

loans.use: to purchase various items such as shampoo, detergent, biscuits, candies, wheat flour, cooking oil, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga tiene 49 años de edad, esta acompañada y es madre de dos hijos. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura junto con su compañero de vida y uno de sus hijos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para  comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas para cultivar maíz y maicillo y para reparar una pared de su casa y construir un corredor a la casa. De esta manera, su casa será más segura y estará su familia más tranquila. Él manifiesta que seguirá trabajando en la agricultura y mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Olga is a 49-year old woman who lives with her partner and has two children. She has worked in agriculture for 15 years with her partner and one of her sons. 

She is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and pesticides to cultivate corn and sorghum, and to repair a wall and build a hallway in her house. Thanks to these improvements, her house will be safer and her family will live more peacefully. She says she plans to continue working in agriculture and improving her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and pesticides to cultivate corn and sorghum, and to repair a wall and build a hallway in her house.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara es una mujer de 62 años de edad, esta acompañada y procreo tres hijos; pero todos están casados. 25 años de experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y fríjol. Así, ella asegurara parte del alimento de su familia y la otra parte de la cosecha la venderá para obtener ingresos que los utilizara en otras necesidades del hogar.

Ella considera que seguirá cultivando más de lo que ya cultiva y seguir trabajando con fundación campo para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Genara is a 62-year-old woman. She is in a relationship and has 3 children, but they are all married. She has 25 years of experience growing corn and beans; she has always made her living through farming.
The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy pesticides and herbicides, and to pay for labor to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and beans. In this way, she will use part of the harvest to feed her family, and she will sell the rest of the harvest in order to make income that she will use for other household necessities.
She thinks that she will continue to plant more than she does now, and she will continue to work with Fundación Campo in order to have better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and herbicides, and to pay for labor to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and beans.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya was born in 1988. She lives in Amman, Jordan. Aya was facing financial challenges in the past, which encouraged her start her business selling blankets and housewares to her neighbors. As she found it profitable, she is now seeking a youth loan to open her own store and start expanding her business. In the future she plans to offer a workshop for sewing blankets, which will increase her income and help her cover her expenses.

loans.use: To open her own blankets store

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is 18 years old. She is single and lives in Mafraq, Jordan with her family, which consists of nine people. She is currently studying for her Bachelor of Nursing degree. Rawan is planning to continue her studies and get a master's degree in the future. As she is facing financial crisis, she is asking for a loan to pay for her school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina mujer de 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos.  Desde hace doce años se dedica a prestar sus servicios como sastre y como propietaria de su taller tiene siete años; esta actividad lo aprendió de su mamá quien se dedicaba a esta misma actividad. Vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 13 años y un hijo de 14 años de edad.

Los materiales que utiliza para la elaboración de productos como trapeadores para pisos y otros productos de uso en las amas de casa como gabachas delantales, ella necesita de tela la que adquiere en las diferentes comerciales de la ciudad y los traslada por medio de auto bus aproximadamente unos treinta y cinco kilómetros hasta su casa donde los fabrica; luego los traslada hacia la ciudad dos ciudades en donde los comercializa. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para la construcción de una habitación y para la compra de más tela para la sastrería.  Con el préstamo, tendrá una mejor calidad de vida, vivirá en mejores condiciones que en las que actualmente vive y también tendrá mayores ingresos económicos. 

Ella planea tener una vivienda que reúna las condicione para su familia y que sus hijos tengan una educación que les permita desempeñar una labor en cualquier institución o servicio que les permita tener sus ingresos para su sostenibilidad.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a 36-year old woman who has two children. She started working as a tailor 12 years ago and has owned her tailor shop for 7 years. She learned this profession from her mother. She lives with her husband and their children, a 13-year old daughter and a 14-year old son. 

She makes mops and other products that housewives use, such as aprons. In order to make these garments she needs fabric that she buys at different stores and brings back home by bus in approximately 35 minutes. Once made, she takes them to two different cities for sale. 

She plans to use the loan to build a room and to buy more fabric for her tailor shop. Thanks to this loan, she will improve her quality of life and increase her income. Her goal is to provide her family with a better home and her children with an education that will allow them to work in an institution or service in the future and to have income to support themselves.

loans.use: to build a room and to buy fabric for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Ráfael Humberto

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 46 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 10 años trabaja como vigilante. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para cambiar las puertas y el piso de la vivienda. De esta manera, tendrá una mejor calidad de vida, vivirá en mejores condiciones que en las que actualmente vive

Él desea, seguir mejorando su vivienda, y seguir trabajando con fundación campo, ya que la atención que le brindaron fue mejor de lo que él esperaba.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 46-year old man who lives with his partner and has three children. He has worked as a guard for 10 years. 

He is requesting a loan to change the doors and floor of his home. Thanks to these improvements, his family will have a better quality of life. His goal is to continue improving his house and to keep working with Fundación Campo, as the service he has received has exceeded his expectations.

loans.use: to change the doors and floor of his home.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 45-year-old woman who is married to Petrus, a 68-year-old man. They have been blessed with three children: Dewi, 17, who is in the second grade of junior high school; Omega, 10, in fifth grade of elementary school; and Lori, 4.

Martha initiated a pig breeding business two years ago. She usually raises the pigs for seven to eight months before selling them. The selling price is around 3,500,000 IDR per pig, depending on the weight. The income from the business enables Martha to support the needs of her family. 

At the moment, Martha has two pigs to raise, and one of them is ready to be sold. She desires to purchase more piglets to raise and build a new pig stall; therefore she applied an individual loan from TLM amounting to 12,500,000 IDR. She hopes that the loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and build a new pig stall

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 66 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as rice, shampoo, soft drinks, coconut wine and other groceries. 

In the future Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is 33 years of age. He is married and blessed with one child. For the past year he has been running a tailoring business in his neighborhood. He makes and sells dresses and trousers. He seeks a loan to buy 100 metres of cloth for his business. The challenge he faces is customers do not pick their clothes in time. He knew of Milango Financial Services through friends. The extra income that will be raised will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy 100 metres of cloth

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 43 years old and married with children.  He has worked in agriculture since 1990 and started a business in 2000.  More specifically, he raises seedlings and crops to sell.  Today, he is successful with a 1-hectare farm on which he plants each year.  With the goal of further developing his agricultural endeavors, Samuel has turned to microfinance for a loan of 15,000 PHP.  He will use this to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm business.  Samuel's children will help with his duties.  He plans to use the income from the loan to improve his family's well-being.  His family is very respected in their village and is friendly.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: José René

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos.  Se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde los 12 años de edad, su familia siempre ha trabajado la tierra y aprendió ayudándoles a sus padres. Él nunca ha desempeñado otra actividad 

Para comprar  los productos que necesita para su producción tiene que viajar 1 hora en un pick up que pasa por su cantón 2 veces al día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas  y productos para dar buen mantenimiento a su ganado como: vitaminas, harinas, sal, medicamentos.

Con el financiamiento, podrá cultivar mas, dar mantenimiento a sus potreros y a su ganado ya que los granos los vende y otros para su consumo y el sacate queda para alimentar  el ganado y venderlo aun precio mayor y obtener mas leche y así sus ingresos serán mas grandes y podrá satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar

Él desea, dejarle a su familia algo propio donde puedan seguir trabajando y hacer crecer mas el patrimonio de la familia
texts.en:
José is a 64-year old man who is married and has three children. He has worked in the cultivation of basic grains since he was 12 years old, an activity that his family has always done and that he learned from his parents. He has never worked in any other activity. In order to buy the necessary products to cultivate, he needs to travel for 1 hour riding a pick up that passes by his canton twice a day. 

He is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and animal feed and products, such as vitamins, flour, salt and medicines. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to cultivate more and to maintain his pastures and livestock. He sells a portion of the grains, keeps another for his own consumption and uses the forage for the animals so that they can be sold at a higher price and produce more milk. All of this will help to improve his revenue and to cover household expenses. His goal is to leave his family with a property where they can keep working and increase the family's patrimony.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and animal feed and products, such as vitamins, flour, salt and medicines.

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Halima is in her late 30’s, is married, and has two children enrolled in school.  For three years now, she has been running a tailoring business, designing clothes.  She is doing great with her business and family.  She works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this will be her fourth loan request which she will use to buy another tailoring machine (overlock machine).  With the previous loans, all repaid, Halima bought a tailoring machine and more clothes materials.  With the profits, she covered her family expenses and school fees.  Halima dreams to be a big designer with a big clothes shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" TOPI", which totals 8 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another tailoring machine.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia, de 56 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. Ofelia se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como verduras, plátanos, huevos, panes, harina, arroz, aceite, azúcar y otros. Para eso cuenta con un puesto instalado en el frontis de su vivienda, ahí atiende de manera amable y muy cordial a cada uno de sus clientes que llegan a su establecimiento. Trabaja con ayuda de su hija y realiza esta labor desde hace 6 años. Considera rentable a su negocio pues le ha permitido salir de muchos apuros económicos, así como poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Le gusta su actividad porque le permite estar en su casa y cuidar de su familia. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando algunas veces no consigue vender todos sus productos en el tiempo establecido, sobre todo las verduras que se malogran en pocos días ocasionándole perdidas en su inversión, pero eso no la desanima y realiza mejor los cálculos de sus ventas para comprar lo necesario y evitar que se descompongan. Además tiene planes de continuar y hacer crecer su negocio buscando incrementar sus ventas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas. Con el monto solicitado comprará plátanos, verduras y otros productos como arroz, huevos, aceites y azúcar.
texts.en:
Ofelia, 56, is married and has four children, with whom she lives in her own house.

Ofelia earns a living selling food products such as vegetables, bananas, eggs, bread, flour, rice, oil, sugar, and other things.  She has a stall set up for this in front of her home where she provides friendly and cordial service to each one of the customers of her establishment.  She works with the help of her daughter and has done this job for six years.

She considers her business profitable because it has allowed her to get out of financial predicaments as well as be able to help her husband with the household expenses.  She likes her job because it allows her to be at home and take care of her family.  On the other hand, she doesn't like it when sometimes she can't manage to sell all her products in due time, especially vegetables that rot in a few days, creating a loss in her investment.  This doesn't discourage her, though, and she makes better calculations from her sales to buy what she needs and avoid spoilage.  In addition, she plans to continue and make her business grow by looking for ways to increase her sales.

Currently she'll request 2500 soles [PEN].  She's grateful for the opportunity offered to get the loan she needs to continue achieving her goals.

With the requested amount she'll buy bananas, vegetables, and other products such as rice, eggs, oil, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy bananas, vegetables, rice, eggs, oil, and other products

loans.name: Ivonne Cecilia

texts.es: Ivonne Cecilia 60 años de edad casada con 4 hijos mayores de edad, del domicilio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de comida ubicado en su casa de habitación, donde elabora a diario entre 2-3 platos distintos, sus comparas las realiza en uno de los mercados de este municipio los cuales todos son al contado, ella ofrece sus ventas al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos de uno de los ingenios más grandes de nuestro país, al igual que a los maestros, alcaldía entre otros, este negocio lo inicia con fondos propios y como alternativo de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y así sacar adelante a sus hijos, uno de sus sueños es mejorar sus vivienda de habitación, su jornada de trabajo empieza desde muy temprano terminado hasta por la tarde, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo como arroz, frijoles, repollo, aceite, tortillas, plátanos, verduras, bolsas, platos entre otros productos y activo fijo, Ivonne agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos y tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en:
Ivonne Cecilia, 60, is married with 4 adult children. She is from Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. Her business consists of making and selling food from her home, where she cooks 2-3 different plates every day. 

She makes her purchases in cash at one of the municipality's markets. She makes sales in cash and on credit to her fixed clients who work in one of the biggest sugar factories in the country, as well as to teachers and government workers, among others. She started this business with her own savings as an alternative job to help with the household expenses and provide for her children. 

One of her dreams is to improve her home. Her work day starts very early and ends in the afternoon. Her goal with this loan is to increase her working capital with the purchase of rice, beans, cabbage, oil, tortillas, bananas, vegetables, bags, and plates, among other products and fixed assets. Ivonne is very grateful for the help which Kiva lenders offer to people with limited financial resources so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to increase her working capital by buying products such as rice, oil, beans, firewood, and cabbage, among others, to make food.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 56 years of age, and still single. She's running a direct-selling business, in which she has been selling personal use products for almost three years. With this, she's earning a net income of PHP 2,000 a month. 

Due to insufficient funds, she decided to ask for a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase talc powder, cologne, body spray, lipsticks, lotions, and facial creams. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted immediately, so that she can improve her business, to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase talc powder, cologne, body spray, lipsticks, lotions, and facial creams.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 34 years old and married with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family.  Nona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items, such as rice, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries.

Nona has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Nona aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as rice, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 22 years old and married to a private employee.  They are blessed with one child.  She owns and operates a retail store in their village for almost 8 years.  In this business, she earns a net income of 500 PHP a day.  Due to financial constraints, she would like to request an 11,000 PHP loan to purchase canned goods, biscuits, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages.  She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can develop and expand her retail store.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and clothes for a boutique business.

loans.name: Bolivia Isabel

texts.es: La cliente vive en la zona de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Empezó con esta actividad hace 14 años y hasta el momento le ha resultado productiva.  Trabaja a partir de las 9 am hasta las 2 pm, todos los días.  Es viuda y todos sus hijos ya son mayores y tienen su compromiso.  Su sueño es poder encementar su casa y poner un bazar propio con mucha mercadería.  Por ahora desea invertir el crédito en la compra de artículos varios para su negocio como sábanas, ropa y licuadoras.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Fortín area of Guayaquil.  She started with this business activity 14 years ago, and still has it.  It has been productive for her.  She works from 9:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. every day.  She is a widow, and all of her children are grown and have their commitments.

Her dream is to be able to expand her house and to set up a her own variety store with a lot of merchandise.

For now she wishes to use the loan to buy various items for her business.  She wants to buy things like sheets, clothes, and blenders.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business (sheets, clothes, and blenders).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bicycle parts and accessories

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
MARIA DE JESUS
DOÑA MARIA DE JESUS TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE,ELLA DESDE HACE CUATRO AÑOS POSEE UNA LIBRERÍA DONDE TAMBIEN TIENE UNA FOTOCOPIADORA. SU LIBRERIA ESTA UBICADA EN PARAJE PALAMA, DE LA ALDEA XESUJ, EN SU CREDITO ANTERIOR FUE BIEN PUNTUAL Y RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, TIENE UNA BEBE Y JUNTO A SU ESPOSO LUCHAN POR SEGUIR ADELANTE Y SACAR ADELANTE A SU BEBE Y DARLE TODO LO MEJOR, SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE HOJAS POR RESMAS, LAMINAS ILUSTRADAS Y ARTICULOS DE LIBRERÍA. LA VENTAJA DE DOÑA JESUS ES QUE EN LA COMUNIDAD ES LA UNICA LIBRERÍA Y POR ELLO TIENE MUCHA DEMANDA, LES AGRADESE POR LA AYUDA BRINDADA Y ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN SEGUIR AYUDANDO EN SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Maria De Jesus

Maria De Jesus is 29 years old and comes from San Martin Jilotepeque. 

For 4 years she has had a bookstore where she also has a photocopier. Her bookstore is located in Paraje Palama in the town of Xesuj. 

She was very punctual and responsible with her installments from her last loan. She has a baby, and she and her husband fight to get ahead, get their baby ahead and give their baby the best. 

She is applying for the loan to buy reams of paper, prints and bookshop items. The advantage Maria has is that hers is the only bookstore in the community and because of this she has a lot of demand. 

She thanks you for the help offered and hopes that you will be able to continue helping her with her business.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper in bulk, and items for a bookstore

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto tiene 40 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Él trabaja en la agricultura desde que era muy joven, oficio que aprendió de su  padres quien ya fallecieron. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su compañera de vida, para prepararse e irse a la parcela que alquila donde pasa parte de la mañana, luego se dirige a trabajar en su molino  durante el resto del día. Compra el abono, la semilla, los herbicidas,etc en la ciudad que esta a  7 Kilómetros del lugar en donde reside.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  una vaca lechera para producir leche. Con la compra de la vaca estaría obteniendo un buen ingreso para el sustento de familia, porque vendería la leche en la comunidad en donde reside.
Él planea comprar mas vacas lecheras para producir leche para la venta y crecer más el negocio.
texts.en:
Fausto, 40, is married and has two children.  He has worked in agriculture since he was very young.  He learned the job from his parents, who already died.

He gets up at 4 a.m. with his life partner to get ready and go to the plot of land he rents, where he spends part of the morning.  Then he goes to his mill to work for the rest of the day.  He buys his soil amendments, seed, herbicide, etc. in the city that's seven kilometers from where he lives.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a dairy cow to produce milk.  With the purchase of the cow he would be getting a good income to support his family, because he would sell the milk in the community where he lives.

He plans to buy more dairy cows to produce milk to sell and to grow the business more.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She is 41 years old, and married with four children. Her husband is a fisherman, while she runs a sari sari store to earn a living. 

Vicky joined Gata Daku MPC in 2012 and recently, she took a loan to purchase canned goods, noodles, and sugar to sell. She planned to use the revenue generated as additional working capital for business expansion. 

She hopes to see her children be successful in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, and sugar

loans.name: Otajon

texts.ru:
Отачон 57-летний водитель, проживающий в городе Истаравшан на севере Таджикистана. Он женат и имеет детей. Старший сын уже обзаведен семьей и живет отдельно. Отачон сейчас живет вместе с женой, младшим сыном и матерью.
 Отачон в течение 15 лет работает водителем и обеспечивает семью за счет этой деятельности. Он на своем микроавтобусе развозит пассажиров по маршрутной линии города и в день совершает 8 рейсов. Отачон по характеру скромный, трудолюбивый и хороший человек. Он еще и занимается животноводством.
В данный момент Отачону необходимо отремонтировать свой микроавтобус, с которым в последнее время происходят технические неполадки и это мешает ему продолжать деятельность. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. На часть кредита он хочет отремонтировать микроавтобус, а на оставшуюся часть провести ремонт в доме и улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en:
Otajon is a 57-year-old driver that lives in Istaravshan in the north of Tajikistan.  He is married with children.  His oldest son has his own family and lives separately.  Otajon now lives with his wife, younger son and his mother.  

For 15 years he has worked and provided for his family as a driver.  He uses his own van to carry passengers along aa route through the city eight times a day.  Otajon is, by character, humble, hardworking and a good person.  He also works with livestock.  

At the moment, Otajon must makes repairs to his van to fix issues that have hindered his business.  With this goal, he is taking out a loan.  A portion of the loan will go to the van repairs and the rest will be used to make home repairs to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to make repairs to his van and home which will allow him to continue his business and improve his circumstances

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis, 28 years old, is still single. Elvis works hard in his farming business; he also has a hog raising business as an additional source of income. 

He is asking for a loan of Php 43,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seedlings. His goal is to improve the economic situation to benefit his parents and siblings. 

Elvis is determined to work very hard and earn more income to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seedlings

loans.name: Kuvonj

texts.ru: Кувондж кредитуется 6 цикл в ИМОНе. Он добросовестный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Кувондж родился в сельской местности в семье пастуха и с детства Кувондж помогал отцу по животноводству. Кувондж занимается животноводством и растениеводством. На площади 1 га весной засеял лук, чей урожай собирает осенью. Помимо этого он держит скот. Корм скоту он собирает с пастбищ за счет чего ему обходиться дешево. По введению бизнеса ему помогает его жена. Он покупает скот, 3-4 месяца пасет на полях, а зимой скот держит дома и откармливает за счет собранного урожая кормов летом. Этот раз он обратился за займом для обустройства жилого дома. Его дом имеет плохое состояние и поэтому он хочет обустроить дом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как древесина, цемент, песок, кирпич и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: This is Kuvonj's sixth loan with IMON.  He is a diligent and hardworking man.  Kuvonj was born in a rural area into a family of shepherds.  Since his childhood, he's helped his father with their animals.  Now he works with livestock and in agriculture.  He has one hectare of land where he plants onions in the spring and harvests the crop in the fall.  He keeps his animals nearby.  The cattle feed while out to pasture since it is cheaper.  His wife helps him conduct his business.  He buys cattle and puts them out to pasture for three or four months.  Then he brings them home during the winter where he fattens them with feed gathered during the summer.  This time, he is requesting a loan to rebuild his home which is in bad condition.  He's asking for $2,000 USD to buy construction materials like wood, cement, sand, bricks, etc.  He awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To buy wood, cement, soil to rebuild his house

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 55 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Anita has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, bread, seasonings and other groceries. 

In the future, Anita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mel

texts.en:
Maria Mel is married and serves as a barangay (village) councilor in the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old and owns and operates her retail store to earn a living. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy rice and feeds for sale, in addition to her working inventory capital. 

Maria Mel hopes to use properly the generated income for the business’ expansion and most of all, to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice and feeds for sale.

loans.name: Mary Raquel

texts.es: MARY RAQUEL DE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE DOÑA MARY, QUIEN DESDE HACE MAS DE 5 AÑOS SE HA DEDICADO A LA CRIANZA DE GANADO VACUNO, QUIEN JUNTO A SU ESPOSO SE HAN DEDICADO A ESTE OFICIO YA QUE EN EL  AREA DONDE VIVE ES PROPICIA Y TAMBIEN TIENE MUCHA DEMANDA. DOÑA MARY HA PROCREADO JUNTO A SU ESPOSO CUATRO NIÑOS, Y POR ELLOS LUCHAN JUNTOS PARA DARLE LO MEJOR A SUS NIÑOS. DOÑA MARY HA SIDO BIEN PUNTUAL Y RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, Y SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA NOVILLA, MARRANOS Y ALIMENTOS PARA LOS MISMOS (CONCENTRADO[) AGRADECE A FAPE Y KIVA EL APOYO QUE LE HAN BRINDADO Y SE COMPROMETE A SEGUIR PUNTUAL Y RESPONSABLE EN SUS DEPOSITOS.
texts.en:
Mary Raquel is 36 years old and from San Martin Jilotepeque. She has worked raising beef cattle for more than 5 years. She has worked in this job with her husband because the area where she lives is favorable and there is also a lot of demand. 

Mary and her husband have 4 children, and they fight to give their children the best. Mary has been very punctual and responsible with her installments and is applying for a loan to buy a heifer, pigs and food (concentrated) for them. 

She thanks FAPE and Kiva for the support they have given and is committed to continue being punctal and responsible with her deposits.

loans.use: to buy a heifer (cattle)

loans.name: Omran

texts.en:
Omran was born in 1987. He lives in Irbid, Jordan with his wife and son. 

Omran has been working in a café, selling tea and coffee since five years ago. He started his project with his brother, and they found their project profitable, which enhanced their financial situation. 

As their café got damaged as a result of long use, Omran is seeking a youth loan to repair its floor and to be able to paint it during Ramadan.

loans.use: to repair and paint the floor of his café.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 55 years old, married and blessed with four children. She started her business by means of an ambulant cart, from which she sells different goods around their village. While running the business, Enriqueta improved the business until she was able to build a mini-grocery in their village.

Enriqueta’s dream is to become a dealer of beverages in their village. Due to lack of capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy beverages and grocery items to sell to different store owners. 

She hopes that her business will gain her a higher income so that she can improve their house.

loans.use: to buy beverages and grocery items to sell to different store owners.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is 22 years old. She lives in Zarqa, Jordan with her family, which consists of two members. 

She is studying for a Bachelors of Financial Economics and is in her third year. Heba is planning to work in her study field after graduation. 

As she is currently facing financial problems, she doesn’t have enough money to pay for her study. So she is seeking a loan to pay for her study fees.

loans.use: to pay for her study fees.

loans.name: Mais

texts.en:
Mais was born in 1987. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a heavy equipment driver. However, his income does not fully cover their children's needs. 

Mais has been coordinating artificial flowers for six months. She started her project as a hobby and found it profitable. She plans to expand her flower arrangement business in the future as it will enhance her financial situation. Mais is seeking a youth loan to buy initial materials for her project.

loans.use: to buy materials to make artificial flowers

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es: La cliente vive en el área del Fortín en Guayaquil.  Tiempo atrás, cuando se encontraba sin un empleo, comenzó a vender artículos pequeños, para después ir vendiendo cosas más grandes.  Sale a laborar en los momentos en que no se encuentra ocupada y también los sábados.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su cónyuge labora como mecánico en un taller.  Tienen 2 hijos, de 11 y 9 años, quines estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Actualmente tiene la intención de invertir el dinero en la compra de mercadería: sábanas, licuadoras y ropa; para comercializarlas en su recorrido.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Fortín area of Guayaquil.  Some time ago, when she found herself without a job, she started selling small items.  Later, she was selling bigger things.  She goes out to work at the times that she is not busy and also on Saturdays.

She is in a common-law marriage, and her husband works as a mechanic in a shop.  They have two children, ages 11 and 9.  The children attend public school in the area.

She now intends to use the loan to buy merchandise, sheets, blenders, and clothes in order to sell them on her route.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sheets, blenders, and clothes).

loans.name: Clara Maribel

texts.es: La cliente vive en la zona de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Comenzó hace tiempo atrás con una pequeña tienda, en la cual trabajó con mucho sacrificio.  Luego de esto, decidió emprender en la venta de artículos a crédito.  Sale a vender sus productos sola, desde las 8 am hasta la 1 pm.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre, su esposo es maestro albañil contratista.  Tiene 4 hijos, de 14, 12, 10 y 8 años; y todos van a la escuela fiscal.  Por el momento, necesita invertir el dinero del préstamo en la adquisición de mercadería para su negocio; como tachos, ropa, utensilios y juegos de vasos.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Fortín area of Guayaquil.  She started some time ago with a small store in which she worked with great sacrifice.  After that she decided to undertake selling items on credit.  She goes out to sell her products alone at 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.

She is in a common-law marriage, and her husband is a contracted master builder.  He has four children, ages 14, 12, 10, and 8.  They all attend the public school.

She now needs to use the loan to get merchandise for her business.  She will get things like containers, clothes, utensils, and sets of glasses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes, containers, utensils, and sets of glasses).

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada con cuatro hijos. Desde muy joven se dedico a ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar, su padre se dedicaba a la agricultura, también en hacer pequeñas ventas para que pudiese ingresar algún dinero a su familia, ademas, cuando no había el capital suficiente para la agricultura tenia que ir a ayudarle a su padre ella y sus demás hermanos y hermanas, aprendió bastante bien la agricultura.

A sus 18 años se acompaño en esa relación procrearon 2 hijos, pero esta relación duro poco tiempo, con mucho esfuerzo trabajo para mantener a sus hijos haciendo ventas, luego se caso y formo nuevamente una familia procreando otros dos hijos y también dedicándose a la agricultura en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos.

Los insumos agrícolas los compra  a 8 kilómetros de su casa; luego tiene que transportarlos hacia su casa pagando un medio de transporte, donde este luego es trasladada en carreta donde tiene los cultivos de maíz.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar una operación que necesita su madre, debido a que es urgente para que pudiese tener fuerza motriz en las piernas. Lo que más desea María es que su madre tenga la posibilidad de caminar sin ningún impedimento.

Para el futuro  quisiera tener su terreno propio para construir  su casa donde vivan ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María is a forty-year-old married woman with four children.  From a very young age she helped her mother in the household chores.  Her father was a farmer, and she also helped in selling some produce so that she would be able to contribute some income to her family. Also, when there was little money to operate the farm, she and her brothers had to help him with the farming work.

She got married at the age of eighteen and has two children from that relationship, though the relationship did not last long.  With a great deal of effort she worked as a vendor to support her children.  Later she re-married and formed a new family, giving birth to two more children.  She now works in agriculture along with her husband and their children.

She travels eight kilometers from their home to buy their farming supplies.  She then has to hire transport to bring the supplies to her house.  From there they bring the supplies by cart to their cornfields.

She is seeking a loan through Fundación Campo in order to pay for an operation that her mother needs so that she can continue to have the use of her legs.  What María wants most is for her mother to be able to walk without any impediments.

In the future she would like to have her own land so that she can build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for an operation that her mother needs.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is forty-five years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. 

Chantha's main source of income is from farming two hectares of land, where she cultivates rice, and serving as the village doctor. She has engaged in her current business for ten years. Chantha has received loans from Vision Fund (Kiva‘s partner) before. She has utilized her past loans, which she has fully repaid, to improve her lifestyle. 

Currently, Chantha is in a four-person loan group. She and other two borrowers are requesting 1,400,000 KHR, whereas the fourth borrower is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. As the loan group leader, she will use her loan to purchase fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticide for her farm. She hopes to make more income from her business so she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Herbeth

texts.es:
Herbeth, de 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en junto a sus tíos y hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Herberh se dedica a dar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros, al empezar lo alquilaban pero viendo que se deterioraba muy rápidamente por el mal uso que le daban,  decidió conducirlo. Iniciándose de esa manera hace más de 03 años cuando se compró su primera unidad, y en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando a otras unidades mientras se deterioraban por el uso cotidiano. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar sus gastos personales, iniciándose por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo estable. Este será su primer préstamo con kiva, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.700 nuevos soles, comprará repuestos para su mototaxi como llantas, asientos y el toldo del mismo, además de pagar al mecánico por el mantenimiento respectivo.
texts.en: Herbeth is a single 21-year-old man who lives with his uncles and brothers in his parents' home. He drives a mototaxi that he worked saved up to buy. At first, he rented the vehicle out, but he saw how its condition was deteriorating very quickly, since the customers did not take good care of it. Thus, he decided to drive it himself. It was three years ago that he bought his first vehicle, and over time he has renovated it as it has been deteriorating from daily use. He likes his line of work because it enables him to have income to meet his personal expenses. He started the business in order to have a source of income, since previously he had been unable to find a stable source of employment. This will be his first loan through Kiva. He is grateful for the financial report so he can continue on. He promises to be punctual with his repayments. With the funds he is seeking, 700 nuevos soles, he will buy parts for his mototaxi such as tires, seats and a sunshade. He will also pay a mechanic to perform the respective maintenance.

loans.use: to purchase parts such as tires and seats, and also to pay the mechanic to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Edwin Efrain

texts.es:
Edwin, tiene 45 años de edad y está soltero, vive con su mama la cual tiene 65 años de edad. El, posee una tienda para salir adelante y obtener ingresos, el oficio lo realiza todos los días y dicha actividad la aprendió con unos familiares, lo desempeña desde hace cinco años.
