El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de mercadería para la tienda, productos de la canasta básica, tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, golosinas, entre otros y productos de limpieza; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar y fortalecer más el negocio.
texts.en:
Edwin is 45 years old, single, and lives with his mother who is 65 years old. He has a store in order to get ahead and earn income.  He works every day and learned this trade from his relatives.  He has done this for five years. 

The loan he requested will help him to buy a variety of merchandise for his store: basic food products such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, candy, and cleaning products. This investment will help to increase his inventory and better his income. His dream is to offer a better quality of life for his relatives and to further strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, candy, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao is 32 years old, married and the father of two children, one of whom just enrolled in school. Being an income provider of the family, he works hard in his career providing transportation services. He owns a motorcycle, which is attached to a trailer so he can charge more from his clients than other Tuk Tuk drivers charge. He has been in this occupation for almost six years.

Sao is requesting a loan of 1,500 US dollars to pay construction laborers, and buy some materials to fix his house. Through the help of the loan, he will be able to renovate his house properly for his family members to live in. 

He promises to pay back the loan in full, and hopes to have the next opportunity to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay construction laborers and buy some materials to fix his house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, 57, is married and has four children. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, in the Philippines with her family. 

Lucia owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has been in this business for years. Each month, she earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Aside from her business, she also helps her husband in their fishing business to generate additional income.

Lucia has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP. She will use the funds to purchase fishing nets, as well as canned goods, sachet products, and noodles to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Lucia wants to build a house and support her children in finishing their education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, as well as canned goods, sachet products, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Primo Feliciano

texts.es: El cliente reside en Playas.  Empezó a laborar desde hace 8 años en los alrededores de la playa vendiendo calzado, como su papá lo hacía tiempo atrás.  De él aprendió todo acerca de este oficio y lo conserva hasta el día de hoy, en que le ha resultado productivo.  Trabaja de lunes a domingo, de 9 am a 5 pm.  Es casado y su esposa trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante.  Tiene un hijo menor, que estudia en la escuela fiscal.  Desea invertir el dinero del préstamo en calzado para comercializarlo entre sus clientes.
texts.en: Primo Feliciano lives in Playas.  About 8 years ago, he started to work in and around Playas selling shoes, just like his father did a long time ago.  Primo learned everything about this business from him, and he still retains this knowledge today, which has made him productive.  He works every day from 9am until 5pm.  Primo is married and his wife works as a kitchen assistant in a restaurant.  He has a minor child who attends public school.  Primo wants to invest the money from this loan in shoes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
SIMONA
DOÑA SIMONA TIENE 71 AÑOS DE EDAD ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE Y DESDE HACE MAS DE 16 AÑOS SE HA DEDICADO A LA COMPRA-VENTA DE GALLINAS LOS COMPRA PEQUEÑOS Y CUANDO YA ESTAN GRANDES LOS VENDE A UN MEJOR PRECIO, AGRADECE A FAPE Y KIVA POR CONFIAR EN ELLA. HA SIDO BIEN RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS. A PESAR DE SU EDAD LUCHA POR TRABAJAR Y ASI COLABORAR CON SU ESPOSO PARA VIVIR DE UNA MANERA DIGNA. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE GALLINAS, Y ALIMENTOS PARA LOS MISMOS(CONCENTRADO).
texts.en: Simona is 71 years old. She is from San Martin Jilotepeque and for the last 16 years she has made a living from buying and selling chickens. She buys them when they are young, and when they are grown she sells them for a better price. She thanks FAPE and Kiva for trusting in her; she has been very responsible in her payments. In spite of her age she strives to work and thus collaborate with her husband to live in a dignified manner. She is asking for the loan to buy chickens and food for them (concentrated).

loans.use: To buy chickens and food for them (concentrated)

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Alfredo quien es padre de sus hijos quienes ya son independientes por esa razón solo vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Gladis se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales por las mañanas. Para eso cuenta con un puesto en el mercado cerca a su casa donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ganándose su preferencia. Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio y preparando en pequeñas cantidades, viendo la acogida que tenía su negocio, decidió continuar, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en la preparación y atención de los clientes. Decidió empezar con éste negocio debido a la necesidad de contar con un oficio y un ingreso económico para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Viendo los buenos resultados que está tendiendo con su negocio tiene planes de continuar y hacerlo crecer. Por tanto éste será su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, comprará utensilios de cocina como ollas, platos, vasos y otros, para renovar los que tiene y así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladis is 48 years old and is married to Alfredo, the father of her children who are already grown up; because her children are independent she lives with just her husband in a house they own. Gladis makes a living from selling regional food in the mornings. For this she has a stall in the market near her house, where she attends to her customers in a friendly and cordial manner, gaining their loyalty. She started her business more than 10 years ago with her own capital, preparing food in small quantities. Seeing the niche that her business had, she decided to continue, and today she has the support of her husband in the preparation of the food and serving customers. She decided to start this business because of the need to have employment and financial income to cover her family’s expenses.

Seeing the good results that she is having with her business, she has plans to continue and to grow her business. This will therefore be her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she is receiving to keep going. She also commits to paying her fees in a punctual manner. With the requested amount of 500 Peruvian nuevos soles, she will buy cooking utensils like pots, plates, glasses and other items to replace the ones she has and thus provide her customers with better service.

loans.use: to buy utensils like pots, plates, glasses and other items

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
José tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a los trabajos agrícolas; fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron debido a que esta es la actividad con la cual obtienen  el alimento para su familia.  Él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a sus esposa para prepararse y marcharse al terreno que alquila para cultivar sus granos básicos.  Pasa toda la mañana y la en tarde trabaja como motorista 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, herbicidas para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de Maíz y para el pago del alquiler del terreno. Solo de esta forma, dispondrá del dinero para cultivar, y no dejar de hacerlo pues esto seria un problema para él y su familia ya que no tendrían el maíz para la alimentación y para vender otra parte y recibir unos ingresos extras.

Su sueño es comprar un terreno para sembrar; ya que el que actualmente lo alquila.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old, is married and has four children. He has made a living from agricultural work for his entire life; his parents were the ones who taught him as that was the business with which they obtained food for his family. He gets up at 4:00 a.m. with his wife to get ready and head out to the land he rents to cultivate his basic grains. He spends the entire morning out there, and in the afternoon he works as a driver.

He is asking for the loan from Fundación Campo to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and to pay the rent on the land. Only in this way will he have the money to continue cultivating his crops, as it would be a problem for him and for his family if they didn’t have the corn for food and to sell the other part to receive extra income.

His dream is to buy land to plant on, as he is currently renting it.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and to pay the rent on the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory for his business.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos,  se le presenta la necesidad de más  capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en la agricultura, por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual le servirá para comprar insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros para preparar la tierra.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro incrementar la producción de maíz y obtener mayores ingresos. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: Carlos needs more working capital to keep investing in agriculture, so he needs a new loan. This will help him buy agricultural supplies like manure, herbicides, and insecticides, among other things to prepare the land. The previous loan was very helpful, because he was able to increase his corn production and make more money. The economic conditions have improved and also his family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, and insecticides, among other things to prepare the land.

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en: A mother of six children and aged 64, Yin is a rice grower on one hectare of farmland in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province where her residential area is. She also supplements her income via running a small stall to sell fried bananas in the village. She has been involved in her current business for ten years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Yin is a third-time borrower and her joint borrower is a second-cycle borrower. Both of them are in the same group and they are seeking the same loan amount of 800,000 KHR each. As the leader, Yin will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She highly believes that she can gain a high yield from her crops and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Asuncion Jocelyn

texts.en:
Asuncion Jocelyn is 54 years old and a widowed mother of four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Asuncion Jocelyn has a food production business in the Philippines. Asuncion Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Asuncion Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Asuncion Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ovidio Antonio

texts.es:
Ovidio, está casado y no tiene hijos, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, entre lo que realiza se encuentran estas: puertas, balcones, portones, dicho oficio lo realiza desde hace 6 años, actividad que la aprendió con un amigo y luego coloco su propio negocio, lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 6:00pm, hasta el momento no presenta ningún problema.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar compresor y la diferencia para capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara  a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias aportar para su familia. 
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar, asimismo crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ovidio is married and has no children. He does not have any family members living abroad. He owns a metal shop in which he makes doors, balconies, and gates, among others. He has been in this profession for six years. He learned about it from a friend and later set up his own business. He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. He has not had any problems so far.

He has applied for a loan to buy a compressor, and he will use the difference for working capital. This investment will help him to strengthen his business and support his family with his earnings.

His dream is to offer his family members a better quality of life and to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and use the difference for working capital.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: Horn, a villager from Takeo province, is 43 years old and married. She has three dependent children who are still in school. Her main source of income is from a pig-raising business and income from her husband who is working at construction site as a paid worker. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years. Horn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three past cycles and has fully repaid back her prior loans with success. The past loans have enabled her to buy more pigs for raising and it has returned a decent income to keep her children in school. For this cycle, she joints a group of three members. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family to improve to a high sanitation practice for her children to prevent any relevant disease.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a concrete floor in his house.

loans.name: Tsira

texts.en:
Tsira is 48 years old and lives in the littoral city of Batumi with her son, daughter-in-law, and infant grandson. Tsira works as a baby nurse, her son is a distributor, and her daughter-in-law is a saleslady at the flower shop. All the family members get monthly salaries.

Tsira has a newly purchased flat in the city center. She managed to make savings and renovate it for renting out, but her income was not enough to buy furniture.

With the start-up credit, Tsira will purchase items and comfortably organize the flat. Summertime is high season in Batumi and it’s full of holidaymakers, so Tsira will rent the flat easily in the summer. 

The new business initiative, financed with Kiva, will significantly increase the family income and the living conditions will be improved. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and comfortably organize her flat for renting out

loans.name: Sayad

texts.en:
Sayad is 62 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city which is in Lori region. Sayad is married and has two daughters. For many years Sayad has worked as a butcher in the central food market of Vanadzor, where he rents a stall for his occupation. Sayad sells pork, mutton, and beef. Sayad buys all the meat from nearby villages as there are farmers with whom Sayad cooperates for many years. He already knows how to choose fresh and tasty meat and to sell it for a profitable and convenient price both for him and for customers.

Sayad asks for a 1,000,000 AMD loan, as he plans to buy several calves and, in winter months, to sell the meat of his own product; this way he will manage to have more profit from his business and less expenses than usual.

loans.use: to buy several calves and, in winter months, to sell the meat of his own product

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 19-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives in a humble house with his family in the city. Abdallah's mother works as an employee in the public sector and makes a low income. This income is barely enough to cover the family's needs. Abdallah is studying engineering in his second year. He is a very smart boy; he is very insistent to complete his studies, but the costs of university learning are very high. 

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. this loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. Since he needs a laptop to use engineering programs, this will make his study and his marks better. This will ensure a better future for Abdallah and his family. 

Abdallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 22 years old. He lives in Irbid-Jordan with his family, which consists of six members. Ahmad is currently studying for a Bachelor of Anthropology and he is in his fourth year. He is planning to expand his study to get the master's degree in the future. He wasn’t able to pay for his semester fees, as he didn’t have money for it because of the financial crisis he is facing. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to pay for his study fees.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Mariela Giovana

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Fortín.  Empezó en el año 2007, cuando escogío esta actividad debido al tiempo que le da para cuidar a sus hijos y realizar las tareas del hogar.  Trabaja todos los días a cualquier hora, por cuenta propia.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su esposo tiene 2 actividades: guardia de seguridad y cuando está libre se dedica a la soldadura.  Tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 estudian en la escuela fiscomisional.  Va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Fortín neighborhood. She is in a civil union and her husband has two businesses. He is a security guard and in his free time he works doing welding. They have three children, two of which are studying at the "fiscomisional" school [a Catholic school provided with government funding].

She started this business in 2007 when she decided to do it due to the time that it would giver her to care for her children and do her household chores. She works everyday at any hour she chooses. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of school supplies for her children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 32 años de edad, está casada con Jorge y tiene 03 hijos de 13, 8 y 5 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Isabel se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de desechos de maderas de las carpinterias cercanas. Tiene un espacio cerca a las carpinterias donde junta sus maderas y les prende fuego dejandolo quemar por varios para que así el carbón este listo.
Se inicio hace más de 05  años, empezando de a poco con un capital propio que fue haciendo crecer con bastante esfuerzo, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su esposo. Decidió empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico que le permitiera sostener a su familia y brindarles asi una buena calidad de vida. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará madera al por mayor para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel, 32, is married to Jorge and has three children, ages 5, 8, and 13. She lives with them in her own house. Isabel makes a living making and selling charcoal made of the wood which local carpentry workshops throw out. She has a space close to the carpentry workshops where she puts all of the wood together and sets fire to it, letting it burn until the coal is ready.

She started her business more than five years ago little by little with her own capital. She worked hard to grow her business along with her husband's support. She decided to start this business due to her need for a financial income to sustain her family and provide them with a good quality of life. Seeing the good results and profits which her business gives her, she would like to continue with and maintain her business, as it is her only source of income. This is her first Kiva loan, and she feels grateful for the financial support which she is receiving to continue moving ahead. She is also committed to paying her installments on time.

With the requested amount of 1000 Peruvian soles, she will buy wholesale wood to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wood.

loans.name: Evelyn Marely

texts.es:
Evelyn, vive con su familia. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa, por lo que se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un  préstamo porque requiere de más capital para invertir en la venta de ropa; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar camisas, blusas, pantalones, calzonetas, entre otros.
Su sueño es  mejorar su negocio y aumentar su clientela, asimismo brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Evelyn lives with her family. She sells clothes. She has decided to ask for a loan as she needs more capital to invest in her clothes selling business. This loan will help her buy shirts, blouses, pants, bathing suits, amongst other things. Her dream is to improve her business and get more clients and as well as offering a higher standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, swimming suits, etc.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
José, requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que necesita de un nuevo préstamo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar planchas eléctricas, sartenes, frasadas, hamacas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, el cual le permitió generar suficientes ingresos para cancelar la deuda y gastos del hogar; hoy en día trabaja con dinero propio.
texts.en: José needs more capital to invest in his business, so he is requesting this loan. He will use it to buy electric irons, frying pans, blankets, hammocks, etc. His last loan was very useful. It helped him to pay off his debt and the household expenses. Now he is working with his own money.

loans.use: to buy electric irons, frying pans, blankets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Leonardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Leonardo pertenecía a una familia de 7 hermanos y su madre; ya que su padre falleció cuando él apenas tenia 3 años, no teniendo el respaldo de su padre sus hermanos tenían que trabajar jornaleando y trabajando en temporadas ya que era una familia de escasos recursos financieros. Actualmente tiene 47 años de edad, es casado.

A medida él iba creciendo y sus hermanos empezaron a trabajar la agricultura por cuenta propia, cuando se caso ya lo realizo con mucho esfuerzo por su cuenta propia. Ademas, se dedicaba a la albañilería, hace 6 años su primo le vendió un molino de mixta mal y con mucho esfuerzo lo adquirió y con la ayuda de un amigo que se había dedicado a esta actividad le enseño como manejarlo eficientemente.

Los materiales para el mantenimiento del molino de mixta mal los compra en un ciudad que esta a 6 kilómetros de su casa, tiene que madrugar y dejar a cargo a alguien que lo sustituya en el manejo del molino y poder regresar en la brevedad posible; ya que es poco el tiempo que le colaboran.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un nuevo motor del molino; ya que el que tiene ya le esta ocasionando problemas. El buen mantenimiento y funcionamiento del molino y dar un mejor servicio a sus cliente quienes lo visitan, ese es su objetivo.

 Leonardo manifiesta que en un futuro quiere comprar otro molino e instalarlo en un lugar estratégico.
texts.en:
Leonardo is from a family of 7 brothers and his mother, since his father died when he was 3 years old.  Without any support from their father, his brothers had to be day laborers and work in seasons since it was a family of limited resources. Leonardo is 47 years old and is married.

As he was growing up and his brothers started working in agriculture on their own, that was when he married. Also, he was engaged in masonry.  Six years ago, his cousin sold him a bad mixed mill and with much effort he acquired it.  With the help of a friend who had worked in that area, he learned how to use it efficiently.  

The materials for the maintenance of the bad mixed mill are bought in a city that is 6 kilometers from his home.  He must get up early and leave, and have someone replace him in managing the mill.  He has to return as soon as possible, and then there is little time to collaborate.  

This loan, requested by Fundación Campo, is to buy a new mill motor; the one that he has is already causing problems.  His objective is to have a well maintained and functioning mill and to give better service to his customers that visit.

Leonardo said that in his future, he wants to buy another mill and install it in a strategic place.

loans.use: to buy a new mill motor; the one he has is already causing problems.

loans.name: Fausto De Jesús

texts.es:
Fausto tiene 64 años de edad, es casado tiene un hijo. Se dedico a trabajar la agricultura desde muy pequeño, proviene de una familia de 8 hermanas y siendo el único varón de su familia era el que tenia que trabajar mas con su padre y ayudarle en la agricultura. A sus 25 años se caso y desde entonces empezó a trabajar a parte de su padre por su cuenta ya que tenia mucha experiencia.

Los insumos agrícolas los compra en dos ciudades dependiendo donde encuentre mas barato los productos que necesita, uno a 6 kilómetros y el otro a 2 kilómetros de su casa, luego tiene que pagar un medio de transporte para que se lo trasladen los productos a su casa, para posteriormente llevarlas al lugar donde va a cultivar, para ello tiene que pagar carretero a un kilómetro de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas y para la preparación de la tierra para la siembra. Al final de la cosecha espera obtener mejores ingresos para él y su familia. Para su futuro espera mejorar su vivienda para tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Fausto, 64, is married with one son. He has worked in agriculture from a very young age. He is from a family with eight sisters and as the only son, he had to work more with his father and help him in the fields. At the age of 25, he got married and began to work independently from his father since he had plenty of experience.

He buys his farm supplies in two different cities, depending on where he finds the products he needs at the cheapest price. One city is 6 kilometers away from his house and the other is 2 kilometers away. Afterwards, he has to pay for transport so that someone can bring the products to his house and later to the area where he plants crops. He has to pay a driver about a kilometer from his house for this.

He has applied for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy manure, fertilizer, and insecticides and to prepare his land for sowing crops. At the end of the harvest, he hopes to have better earnings for himself and his family. In the future, he hopes to improve his home so that he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and insecticides and prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Lidia Solange

texts.es: La cliente corresponde al sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Empezó en este negocio hace 5 años y escogió esta actividad porque le deja buenas ganancias y le da tiempo para estar con sus hijas.  Trabaja de lunes a viernes con sus hermanos.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, una pequeña y la mayor que estudia en escuela particular.  Por ahora necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería para su negocio como blusas, shorts, carteras.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the neighborhood of Fortín in Guayaquil.  She is single and has two children, one little daughter and an older daughter who studies at a private school. 

She began her business five years ago and she chose this business because it provides her with a good income and gives her time to be with her daughters. She works Monday to Friday with her siblings. For now, she needs this money to buy merchandise for her business like blouses, shorts and wallets.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business (blouses, wallets, shorts)

loans.name: Dolores Armida

texts.es:
Dolores, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, porque requiere de más capital trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar frutas y verduras tales como: tomates, repollos, ejotes, chipilín, cebollas, zanahorias, papas, uvas, manzanas, entre otros. 
El efecto del crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que siempre mantiene surtido el negocio por lo que sus ventas han mejorado, las circunstancias familiares se mantienen. Ella, desea adquirir un pick up para hacer viajes y así obtener mejores ingresos, asimismo ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dolores has opted to apply for a new loan because she is in need of more working capital. This investment will help her to buy fruits and vegetables, such as tomatoes, cabbage, green beans, chipilin leaves, onions, carrots, potatoes, grapes, and apples, among others. 

Her previous loan had a positive effect, because she always keeps her business stocked and her sales have improved. Her family circumstances are the same. She would like to buy a pick-up truck to make trips, thereby obtaining a higher income. She would also like to expand her home.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, green beans, chipilin leaves, onions, carrots, potatoes, grapes, and apples, among others.

loans.name: Arena Blanca Group

texts.es:
La señora Martha es de estado civil soltera, tiene 51 años de edad, de escolaridad tercero primaria, se dedica a tejer cortes y guipiles, aprendio este negocio ayudando a su madre con sus tejidos y hasta la fecha lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para poder elaborar sus tejidos, desea en el futuro vender sus tejidos en otros lugares fuera de su lugar de origen. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agrícolas y a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Martha, 51, is single and has a third-grade primary school education. She makes traditional woven skirts and blouses. She learned about this business by helping her mother with her weaving. She now has twenty years' worth of experience, and her family supports her.

She has organized a group and applied for a loan, which she will use to buy thread for weaving. In the future, she would like to sell her woven clothing in other places besides her native town. The other members of this group work in farming and agriculture.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Daniel Emmanuel

texts.es:
Daniel, está soltero y no tiene familiares en el extranjero, asimismo no posee hijos. El, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y lo realiza de manera ambulante, inicia su negocio como sustento y ayuda para su familia, lo desempeña de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar  variedad de productos, tales como: vitaminas, energizantes para la cabeza; esta inversión le servirá de mucha ayuda para aumentar la clientela, su negocio y sus ventas.
Su sueño es mejorar económicamente y obtener mas clientela.
texts.en: Daniel is single with no family members living abroad. Nor does he have children. He sells natural medicines in the streets. He works from 8am to 4pm. He started his business with the support and help of his family. Daniel is requesting this loan in order to buy a variety of products such as vitamins and energy drinks. The loan will help him increase his clientele, business and sales. His dream is to advance economically and get more customers.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and energy drinks.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Tiempo atrás, su esposo se desempeñaba como vendedor y recaudador de una empresa que quebró.  Luego de ésto, ambos emprendieron en este negocio hasta ahora y les ha ido muy bien.  Trabajan juntos y tienen a 2 personas más para que laboren el fin de semana.  Han convertido esta actividad en el negocio de la familia.  Tienen 2 hijos, uno es pequeño aún y el otro estudia en una escuela fiscomisional.  Al momento, necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una computadora que le ayude en las labores escolares a su hijo.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Fortín neighborhood in Guayaquil.  Some time ago, her husband was laid off from his job as a salesman and collections agent for a company that went bankrupt. After that, they both launched this business and now it is going very well for them. They work together and have two other employees that work on weekends. They have made this enterprise their family business. 

They have two children. One them is still small and the other studies at a "fiscomisional" school [a state-funded religious school]. Right now she needs this loan to invest in the purchase of a computer that will help her son in his school work.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en: Emzar is a 47-year-old farmer from the village of Kveda Tsinsvla. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and an infant granddaughter. He has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. Emzar works hard on his family-owned dairy farm with a milk cow. They milk it and produce cheese. In addition, he grows citrus on the agricultural land. Emzar always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. In addition, Emzar is a mini-bus driver and transports passengers from his village to the district. He works hard but the existing income is not enough to cover the food and everyday expenses for his five-member family. That’s why Emzar decided to start a greenhouse and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of economic conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables vulnerable poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $4000 for constructing the greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and after the greenhouse is built, Emzar will sow cucumbers there. The family will sell the harvest to retailers and this new business initiative will give Emzar the chance to have financial stability.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse and sow cucumbers

loans.name: Elisa Andrea

texts.es: La señora Elisa tiene cuarenta y cuatro (44) años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, departamento de Bolivar; este municipio es considerado como el primer centro artesanal de la costa Atlántica de Colombia, además también el primer comercializador de productos elaborados en telar vertical como hamacas y su diversificación, también produce productos elaborados en croché y macramé, así como también productos de la madera, la talabartería y los instrumentos de gaita entre otros. La señora Elisa tiene cinco (5) hijos en edades de nueve (9) a veintitrés (23) años. Su actividad de negocio es el trabajo de artesanías en tejeduría de hamacas y bolsos; dicha actividad la inició desde hace veinte (20) años, por tradición familiar, permitiéndole con ella sostener y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de materiales para elaborar hamacas de hilo fino, y bolsos. Cuenta con la ayuda de un hijo que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, el cual le ayuda con la venta de estos productos en esta ciudad. Sueña con tener un almacen de artesanías en la ciudad de Cartagena. Algunos de sus indicadores financieros son: Capital de trabajo $1.300.000, Rentabilidad sobre ventas 10%, Endeudamiento futuro 44%.
texts.en:
Elisa is 44 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, the department of Bolivar.  This municipality is considered like the first artisanal center on the Atlantic coast of Colombia.  In addition, it was the first marketer of elaborate and diverse products made on a vertical loom, like hammocks. It also made crochet and macrame products, as well as wood products, saddlery, bagpipe instruments and others.  

Elisa has 5 children, between the ages of 9 and 23 years old.  Her area of business is artisanal work, in weaving hammocks and bags.  
 
She counts on the help of a child that lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias, who helps her sell those products in the city.  She dreams to have an artisanal store in the city of Cartagena.  Some of the financial indications are: $1.300.000 working capital, 10% return on sales, and future borrowing of 44%.

loans.use: to buy materials to make hammocks of fine thread and purses.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, once becoming sure that Kiva lenders can be the best partners in her trading business, without any hesitation has decided to have one more deal with them. 

Mariam continues her men’s and women’s clothes trading business. Her family is very happy to see how well Mariam manages her business.  Mariam and her family (she has two grown-up daughters) live in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. 

In the same city, at a rented stall, Mariam has her trading activities. She sells sweaters, jackets, dresses, blouses, skirts and trousers. Mariam, with the help of her husband, brings all these products from Yerevan in a rented car several times a month.

This time, Mariam needs a loan of 850,000 AMD, as she wants to buy a lot of summer season clothes for her business. She thinks that this loan will bring her a decent income and will help her to solve numerous financial problems that her family has.

loans.use: to buy a lot of summer season clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rafael Alberto

texts.es:
Rafael  es un hombre de 29 años de edad, acompañado y padre de tres hijos. tiene mucha experiencia en la actividades  que realiza, como en el cultivo de maíz de invierno  y bajo riego;  ya que toda su vida se a dedicado a dichas actividad el cual manifestó que la aprendió de sus padres y lo sigue desarrollando hoy por su propia cuenta junto a su compañero de vida; con el cual tiene 9 años de estar juntos.

  Viaja unos 800 metros  a pie hasta donde toma un autobús o pick up, el recorrido tarda unos 25 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad donde compra los insumos(fertilizante, semilla, pesticidas) para su cultivo de maíz;  luego se regresa pagando un pick up para llevar los insumos hasta su casa de donde los traslada en carreta hasta el terreno donde tiene el cultivo para ser aplicados.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, semillas, pesticidas, pago de mano de obra y maquinaria para  preparar 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra y cultivar maíz y pipían.  

Gracias al préstamo podrá darle un mejor beneficio a sus cultivos, de los  cuales espera tener mejor producción y teniendo mejor producción dispondrá de mejores ingresos económicos para su familia y de las pocas ganancias espera mejorar su vivienda  para darles una vivienda un poco digna a sus hijos.

Su propósito, es construir una vivienda digna donde pueda vivir con sus hijos y su compañera de vida; también espera que Dios le de vida para darles un estudio a sus  hijos y seguir cultivando la tierra para lograr sus metas proyectadas.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 29 year old man. He is married and the father of three children. He has a lot of experience in the activities he does, such as growing winter, low-irrigation corn. His whole life he has worked in these activities and he says that he learned them from his go parents and he keeps doing them today on his own with his life's companion, with whom he has been for 9 years.

He travels about 800 metros on foot to where he catches the bus or pick up, which takes about 25 minutes to reach the city where he buys his materials (fertilizer, seeds, pesticides) to grow his corn. Later he returns paying a pick-up to bring the materials to his house where he takes them in a cart to the land where his crop is to apply them.

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, to pay for labor and machinery to prepare 14,000 square meters of land to grow corn and pipían.  

Thanks to the loan, he will be bale to give his crop more benefits, and from that he hopes to have a better yield and have better income for his family and from his small profits he hopes to improve his home to provide a worthy home for his children. 

His objective is to build a worthy home where his children and his life's companion can live. He also hopes that God will give him life to educate his children and keep farming the land to achieve his projected goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, to pay for labor and machinery to prepare 14,000 square meters of land and grow corn and pipían.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof over her kitchen.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 30 years old. He is married and has one daughter. He lives in Zarqa, Jordan. Ali has been working as a car electrician for six years. He started as an employee. Then he opened his own workshop with two others helping him with his work. His project is profitable so he is planning to expand his project in the future. Now he is asking for a youth loan to buy parts that are needed for his work.

loans.use: To buy parts that are needed for car electrical work

loans.name: San Pedro Nima Group

texts.es:
El señor Aurelio de estado civil casado, tiene 32 años de edad, cursó 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, inició este negocio por la necesidad de generar un empleo y poder mantener a su familia, hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para agricultura tales como: fertilizante, semillas, plaguicidas entre otros; espera en el futuro tener abundanetes y buenas cosechas. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siemra de maíz, frijol y café.
texts.en:
Señor Aurelio is married, 32-years old and completed six years of primary education.  He has four children, and two of them are in school.   Señor Aurelio makes his living in agriculture.  He started his business out of a need to start working and support his family.  At this time, he has fifteen years of experience. 

Señor Aurelio organizes a group and is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, seeds, insecticide and other items.  In the future, he hopes to have decent and abundant harvests.  The other members of the group make their livings planting corn, beans and coffee.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Oscar Joel

texts.es:
Oscar, es una persona muy reconocida en la comunidad por sus buenas labores, vive actualmente con sus padres y está soltero, no tiene hijos ni cuenta con familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la agricultura, tales como: crianza y comercio de ganado, asimismo al cultivo de granos básicos, dicha actividad la ha realiza desde hace 6 años y lo aprendió de sus padres; existe dificultad por los altos costos del mantenimiento pero también su ventaja porque posee terrenos con pasto propio. 
El crédito que solicita le permitirá comprar concentrado para el ganado y con ello le permitirá aumentar la producción, esta inversión le ayudara a sostener su actividad más rentable. Uno de los riesgos que podría pasar es una posible enfermedad en el ganado.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para generar más ganancias económicas y en el futuro poder casarse para construir su propia familia. En cuanto a su actividad, crear un negocio más rentable que le ayude a seguir subsistiendo  en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Oscar is a very recognized person in his community for his good work.  He actually lives with his parents and is single.  He does not have children or relatives abroad.  He works in agriculture doing cattle rearing and cultivating basic grains.  He has done this kind of work for 6 years and learned it from his parents.  Difficulty exists due to high maintenance costs but also an advantage because he owns the pasture itself.

The loan he is requesting is to buy concentrate for the cattle and with this, he can increase production.  This investment will help sustain more profitable business.  One of the risks that could happen is a possible disease in cattle.   

His dream is to continue working to generate more income, so that in the future he can marry to start his own family.  In terms of activity, he hopes that profits from his business will enable him to be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for the cattle.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 31-year-old single man. He lives with his mother in a small village near Jenin City. Mohammad is a construction worker outside Jenin. Because his ability to go to work every day is inhibited by the checkpoint between his city and where he works, his income is unstable and he often faces daily challenges in his effort to make a living.

Mohammad requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new furniture for his home, so Mohammad and his future wife will live in good living conditions. 

Mohammad appears in the Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his home

loans.name: Olga Clotilde

texts.es:
San Juan de Limay conocido en gran parte por su artesanía y gente trabajadora, fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua. Ahí  Vive  la señora Olga de 55 años de edad, casada, con un núcleo familiar de dos hijos, de profesión agricultora en ganado de leche y novillos de engorde, con otras actividades en venta de lácteos y refrescos.

Actualmente está aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento adquiriendo  un financiamiento para el mejoramiento de su unidad sanitaria de su vivienda, y necesita comprar su tanque séptico de 750 litros ,cerramiento más gastos de mano de obra, destacando que ella tiene su baño, lavamanos e inodoro y desea terminar su instalación,  ya que conoce la importancia de utilizar un saneamiento mejorado,

Por medio  de esta  alianza, su familia tiene acceso a este proyecto que está beneficiando a varios municipios del país, lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida y contribuir al deterioro del medio ambiente, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias con condiciones económicas más pobre que hacen el uso de letrinas,  el cual causan más enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es `por ello la necesidad de hacer estos proyectos dirigidos al sector más vulnerable de nuestro país y contribuir a su desarrollo.
texts.en:
San Juan de Limay is largely known for its handicrafts and hard-working people.  It was chosen for the Nicaraguan initiative to expand access to sanitation facilities.  Señora Olga lives there.  She is 55-years old, married and has two children.  She is a farmer who has dairy and beef cattle.  She also sells milk products and carbonated beverages. 

Señora Olga is currently applying to the water and sanitation project.  She needs a loan to improve the bathroom her home.  She needs to purchase her 750 liter septic tank and cap and to pay for labor costs.  She points out that she has her bath, sink and toilet and wants to complete their installation.  She knows the importance of having better sanitation. 

Through the initiative, Señora Olga's family has access to this project, which is benefiting various municipalities in the country.  It will allow her to improve her quality of life and damage to the environment.  These programs help families living in the poorest conditions who use latrines, which cause more illnesses and contaminate the environment.  That is why these projects need to be directed to the most vulnerable sectors of the country and to contribute to their development.

loans.use: to pay for a 750 liter septic tank and cap and labor.

loans.name: Amaal

texts.en:
Amaal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo while he is working in his grocery store.

Amaal is a 34-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two sons and one daughter. Amaal's husband works in a grocery store he owns that has been opened for five years. It is a profitable business but needs more money to be improved.
 
Amaal took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy grocery products for her husband's store. This will improve his business and his income will be increased.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for her husband's store.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en:
Ikhlas is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo while he was working in his bakery.

Ikhlas is a 21-year-old married woman from Beit Lahia near Jabalia city. Her husband works in a bakery he owns. It has been working for two years. His bakery is very profitable but needs to be improved because he still works with a very old oven and machines.
 
Ikhlas took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ikhlas's husband to buy a new dough-making machine and wood for the oven. This will improve his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy a new dough-making machine and wood for the oven.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesús

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 



San Juan de Limay un municipio que pertenece al departamento de Estelí conocido en gran parte por su artesanía y gente trabajadora en la ganadería fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua. Ahí vive el señor natividad  de 36 años de edad, casado. Con un núcleo familiar compuesto por su esposa y tres hijos, de profesión constructor de vivienda.  

Actualmente está aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento , a través de un financiamiento para el mejoramiento de su unidad sanitaria de su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias y necesita comprar su inodoro económico ,lavamanos, tuberías para conexiones de agua potable y tanque econosan de 750 litros ya que  conoce la importancia de utilizar un saneamiento mejorado 

Por medio  de esta  alianza, su familia tiene acceso a este proyecto que está beneficiando a varios municipios del país, lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida y contribuir al deterioro del medio ambiente, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias con condiciones económicas más pobre que hacen el uso de letrinas,  el cual causan más enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es `por ello la necesidad de hacer estos proyectos dirigidos al sector más vulnerable de nuestro país y contribuir a su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Client Profile 

San Juan de Limay is a municipality in Estelí Department largely known for its handicrafts and hard-working ranchers.  It was chosen for the Nicaraguan initiative to expand access to sanitation facilities. Señor Natividad lives there.  He is 36-years old, married and his nuclear family is made up of his wife and three children.  Professionally, he is a home builder. 

Señor Natividad is currently applying to the water and sanitation project through a loan to improve the bathroom in his house.  He doesn't have the proper conditions and he needs to purchase a low-cost toilet, a sink, tubing for potable water connections and a 750 liter Econosan.  He knows the importance of improved sanitation.   

Through the initiative, Señor Natividad's family has access to this project, which is benefiting various municipalities in the country. It will allow him to improve his quality of life and damage to the environment. These programs help families living in the poorest conditions who use latrines, which cause more illnesses and contaminate the environment. That is why these projects need to be directed to the most vulnerable sectors of the country and to contribute to their development.

loans.use: to purchase an inexpensive toilet, a sink, potable water connections and a 750 liter Econosan and cap

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Amy works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling personal products. 

Amy is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to her customers.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Shohruy

texts.ru: Шохруй целеустремленный и энергичный молодой человек. Ему 20 лет. Он не женат и живет вместе с родителями и братом. Шохруй учится в Политехническом Университете Таджикистана по специальности строитель-архитектор. Шохруй является одним из успешных студентов. Он своевременно выполняет все домашние задания и помогает своим однокурсникам, если они нуждаются в помощи. Он в свободное время помогает отцу по земледелию. Они выращивают пшеницу и картошку. Шохруй должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет достаточно денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 550 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shohruy is a goal-oriented and energetic young man. He is 20 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and brother. Shohruy is a student at the Tajikistan Polytechnic University, majoring in architecture. He is a high-achieving student. He completes all his homework in time and helps his fellow students when needed. In his free time, he helps his father grow crops. They grow wheat and potatoes. Shohruy needs to pay his university tuition but his funds are insufficient. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 550 USD to pay for his tuition. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university.

loans.name: Sarath's Group

texts.en:
A farmer originally from Samrong district of Takeo province where her resident area is, Sarath is married and has four children. Currently only one of her kids is in school.

To strive for a living and for the sake of her children she grows rice and her husband works as a construction worker. This is the business that she has been involved in since she was 28 years old. 

Including this loan, Sarath is a second-cycled client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to sustain her living and keep her kid in school. Now she wants to build a decent latrine for her family. Therefore, she forms a group of two to apply for latrine loan. She hopes to own a proper standard latrine to improve hygienic practices in her household.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana es una señora muy trabajadora quien vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, por quienes se esfuerza a diario para salir adelante y poder proveerles las necesidades básicas para vivir. Ana se dedica a la venta de huevos y pollos, y su venta la realiza en su casa de habitación. Su esposo trabaja comercializando medicinas naturales, a lo cual se ha dedicado desde hace muchos años por lo que cuenta con clientes fijos. Ana solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de láminas y reforzar la estructura de techo con vigas nuevas. La galera actual tiene muchas goteras, acá resguarda a sus pollos y los huevos que vende y donde también almacena otros utensilios del hogar, la mala condición del techo le dificulta realizar su trabajo y quehaceres del hogar. Ella está dispuesta a invertir bien su dinero y solventar esta necesidad que le es de mucha urgencia.
texts.en:
Ana is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband and children, for whose sake she does her best every day to succeed and provide the basic necessities of life. 

Anna sells eggs and chickens from her home. Her husband works selling natural medicines. He has been doing this work for many years, so he has steady customers. Ana is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can have the money she needs to purchase sheet metal roofing and strengthen the roof structure with new beams. 

The present porch area has many leaks, and it is here that she keeps the chickens and eggs she sells and where she also stores other household utensils. The poor condition of the roof makes it difficult for her to carry out her work and household chores. She is ready to invest her money well and pay for this necessity that is very urgent for her.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal roofing for improving her house.

loans.name: Muhoyo

texts.ru: Мухоё способная, энергичная и независимая женщина. Она замужем, ей 30 лет. У нее двое милых детей - одному 7 лет, другому 4 года. Мухоё живет с мужем, детьми, свёкром, свекровью и шурином в районе Спитамен. Ее муж является мастером строителем. Свёкор работает в мелькомбинате. Шурин предоставляет услуги такси. Сама Мухоё на протяжении 4-х лет занимается выращиванием крупно-рогатого скота для продажи. Ей в купле-продаже скота помогают муж и свёкор. Вблизи их дома имеется хорошее пастбище, где Мухоё разводит скот. Кроме этого Мухоё занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев. Сейчас в ее хозяйстве имеются один бык и одна корова с теленком. Мухоё просит кредит для увеличения поголовья скота. На сумму кредита она хочет купить двух коров и корм скота и продвинуть деятельность.
texts.en:
Muhoyo is a capable, energetic, and independent woman. She is married and 30 years old. She has two sweet children one is seven years old, and the other is four years old. Muhoyo lives with her husband, children, father and brother-in-law, in the Spitamenes region of Tajikistan. Her husband works as a master builder. Her father-in-law works in a mill. Her brother-in-law provides a taxi service. Muhoyo, herself, has been engaged in raising cattle for sale. She raises and sells cattle to help her husband and father-in-law. Near their home there is a good pasture where Muhoyo raises the cattle. 
In addition Muhoyo is engaged in the sewing their national dress. Currently her household has on bull and one cow with a calf. With the loan she hopes to buy two cows and cattle feed to fatten the cattle.

loans.use: Two buy two head of cattle and feed.

loans.name: Cesar Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Cesar tiene cuarenta y nueve (49) años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, departamento de Bolivar; este municipio es considerado como el primer centro artesanal de la costa Atlántica de Colombia, además también el primer comercializador de productos elaborados en telar vertical como hamacas y su diversificación, también produce productos elaborados en croché y macramé, así como también productos de la madera, la talabartería y los instrumentos de gaita entre otros. Cesar tiene dos (2) hijos en edades de dieciséis (16) y diecinueve (19) años de edad, solo vive con uno de ellos. Su actividad de negocio son las artesanías de hamacas; actividad que aprendió trabajando como empleado inicialmente, luego por la necesidad de generar mas ingresos, decide independizarse. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de materiales para elaborar hamacas, ya que tiene pedidos que no puede atender por la falta de un mayor capital. Tiene como meta a futuro, adecuar un local comercial en su casa, donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y los materiales para la elaboración de estos productos. Algunos de sus indicadores financieros son: Capital de trabajo $1.000.000, Rentabilidad sobre ventas 18%, Endeudamiento futuro 51%.
texts.en: Cesar is 49 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, department of Bolivar. This place is known as the first craft center on Colombia's Atlantic coast as well as the first place to sell handmade products made on vertical looms, like hammocks and other items. The city also produces works of croché and macramé, as well as woodwork, leather goods, flutes and other items. Cesar has two children, ages 16 and 19, only one of which lives with him. He makes a living making hammocks. He learned the trade working as an employee, and then decided to go out on his own to earn more income. This is his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to use it to purchase materials to make hammocks, since he has orders that he cannot fulfill because of a lack of capital. His goal for the future is to set up a commercial space in his home where he can offer his products and the materials needed to make them. Some of his financial statistics include: $1,000 of working capital, 18 percent return on sales and a debt ratio of 51 percent.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hammocks.

loans.name: Alma Consuelo

texts.es: Alma es madre de  cinco hijos de los cuales los dos de mayor edad trabajan como camioneros (motorista de camiones al igual que su padre). Alma es ama de casa dedicada a comercializar pollos y huevos, con lo que puede brindar ayuda para solventar los gastos del hogar, así mismo cuida a sus tres pequeños hijos. Alma y su familia cuentan con una pequeña casa hecha de lámina, muy vulnerable a las inclemencias del tiempo, como la lluvia y el viento, por lo que es necesario realizar algunos refuerzos urgentes. Ella solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda comprar: láminas, madera, clavos, entre otros más con lo que no sólo pueda reparar el techo, sino también las paredes que están hechas de lámina y madera. Hace 25 años que vive en esta humilde casa y hace mucho fue la última vez que Alma y su esposo pudieron realizar arreglos a su vivienda. La visita de FUSAI a su comunidad le despertó su interés de prestar el dinero para realizar las mejoras de su casa; convencida que con esto resguardará mejor a su familia de la lluvia, el sol y el viento.
texts.en:
Alma is a mother of five children, of whom the oldest two work as truck drivers, like their father. Alma is a housewife who sells chickens and eggs which helps to pay for household expenses and support her three young children. 

Alma and her family have a small house made of sheet metal which is susceptible to bad weather such as rain and wind, and is badly in need of reinforcement. She is requesting a loan with which she can buy sheet metal, wood, nails, and other materials that will allow her not only to repair the roof, but also the walls, which are made of metal and wood.  

She has lived in this house for 25 years and it has been a long time since she and her husband have been able to make repairs to the home. FUSAI's visit to her community ignited her interest in borrowing money to make improvements to her house. She believes that this would better protect her family from the rain, sun, and wind.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mileydis

texts.es: La señora Mileydis tiene veintiséis (26) años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Jacinto, departamento de Bolivar; este municipio es considerado como el primer centro artesanal de la costa Atlántica de Colombia, además también el primer comercializador de productos elaborados en telar vertical como hamacas y su diversificación, también produce productos elaborados en croché y macramé, así como también productos de la madera, la talabartería y los instrumentos de gaita entre otros. Mileydis es madre soltera, tiene un (1) hijo de dos (2) años de edad. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la venta de productos para tiendas y productos de artesanías que ella elabora. Aprendió a tejer mochilas con las vecinas y también con el SENA (Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje) realizó un curso en tejeduría vertical y horizontal. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de viveres para tienda y materiales para la elaboración de mochilas. Su sueño a futuro es tener una tienda grande y un almacen de artesanías, ya que uno de sus desafíos es sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en: Mileydis is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, department of Bolivar. This place is known as the first craft center on Colombia's Atlantic Coast, as well as the first place to sell handmade products made on vertical looms like hammocks and other items. It also produces crochet and macramé items, as well as woodwork, leather goods, flutes and other items. Mileydis is a single mother with a 2-year-old son. She makes a living selling general products and crafts she makes herself. She learned to weave backpacks from her neighbors and also from SENA (National Apprenticeship Service), taking a course on vertical and horizontal weaving. This is her first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she plans to use it to purchase groceries for her store as well as materials to make backpacks. Her dream for the future is to have a big store and a warehouse of crafts, since one of her challenges is to keep making headway for her son.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and materials to make backpacks.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad es madre soltera de una niña de 16 y un niño de 17 años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar, ella trabaja muy duro como agricultora y así mismo comercializa productos de belleza por catálogo, con lo que puede salir adelante brindándoles lo necesario a sus hijos. Debido a que ella sola se dedica a cuidar y sustentar a sus hijos, María da prioridades a la alimentación, vestimenta y estudios de sus hijos, situación por la que su casa se ha ido deteriorando poco a poco. María desea reparar una habitación de su casa en donde duermen sus pequeños, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de: láminas, cemento, polines, arena y otros materiales de construcción para realizar las reparaciones necesarias a la habitación. Esto será de gran ayuda para ella, puesto que gracias a dicho préstamo les brindará un hogar cómodo y seguro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria, 54, is a single mother of a 16 year old girl and a 17 year old boy who are both in school. She works very hard as a farmer, and also sells beauty products from a catalog, so that she can get ahead and give her kids what they need. Due to the fact that she is the only one caring for and sustaining her children, Maria prioritizes food, clothing and her children's education, which has meant that her house has been deteriorating little by little. She wants to repair one of the rooms in her house where her kids sleep, which is why she has asked for a loan to buy tin sheeting, cement, wood pallets, sand, and other construction materials to make the necessary repairs. This will be a great help to her, since thanks to this loan she will be able to give her children a safe and comfortable home.

loans.use: to buy tin sheeting, cement and sand to repair her home.

loans.name: María Olimpia

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 




	San Juan de Limay conocido en gran parte por su artesanía y gente trabajadora en la ganadería, este municipio fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua. Ahí  Vive  la señora María de 46 años de edad, casada con un núcleo familiar de dos hijos, su profesión es ser comerciante de lácteos y agricultora ya que posee una finca con ganado de leche y engorde de novillos. 

Actualmente está aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento , a través de un financiamiento para el mejoramiento de su unidad sanitaria de su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias y necesita comprar su inodoro económico ,lavamanos, cerramientos  , biodigestor de 750 litros más gastos de mano de obra, ya que conocen la importancia de utilizar un saneamiento mejorado 

Por medio  de esta  alianza, su familia tiene acceso a este proyecto que está beneficiando a varios municipios del país, lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida y contribuir al deterioro del medio ambiente, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias con condiciones económicas más pobre que hacen el uso de letrinas,  el cual causan más enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es `por ello la necesidad de hacer estos proyectos dirigidos al sector más vulnerable de nuestro país.
texts.en: San Juan de Limay is known in large part for its crafts and the hardworking people who make a living in livestock. This town was chosen to take part in a program to strengthen the local sanitation abilities in Nicaragua. Here lives Maria, a 46-year-old married mother of two children. She makes a living selling dairy and other farm products, since she has a farm with milk cows and young steers. She is applying for the water and sanitation project, through which she will use the loan to improve the bathroom in her home, since it lacks ideal conditions. She needs to purchase a toilet, sink, water connections and a garbage disposal, as well as pay for labor, because she knows the importance of improving her home's sanitation. Through this program, her family has access to a project benefiting a number of towns in the country, allowing people to improve their quality of life and protect the environment. These programs are helping families who live in very poor conditions and use latrines, which cause sickness and contaminate the surrounding area. That is why these projects are needed in the most vulnerable areas of the country.

loans.use: to purchase a toilet, sink, water connections, a garbage disposal and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to purchase feed, medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Luisa has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Kun's Group

texts.en: Originally from Samrong district of Takeo province, Kun is a parent blessed with five children, one of whom is still in school. Kun makes a living via rice farming whilst her husband works at a construction site. This is the business that she has had for 25 years. Kun is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed her past loan wisely to support her business and make a decent income to renovate her house and keep her kid in school. Now, in a group of three, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to construct a proper latrine for her family. She hopes to own a proper latrine for her family.

loans.use: To construct a proper latrine for her family

loans.name: Kety

texts.es: Ketty, a sus 19 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y aún no tiene hijos. Por falta de experiencia laboral y oportunidades, le ha sido  difícil emplearse, por esa razón decidió buscar opciones para progresar por sí misma y montó una pequeña papelería hace 3 años, inició con un ahorro familiar y su jornada laboral comienza desde muy temprano en la mañana, para aprovechar los horarios escolares, que le permiten atraer más clientes. Ketty es una joven enérgica, trabajadora y con su visión emprendedora siempre está buscando opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por esa razón solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (resmas de papel, lapiceros, marcadores, cinta adhesiva, témperas, entre otros) con el fin de darle continuidad a sus negocio y tener disponibilidad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes de manera oportuna, esto le permitirá a Ketty avanzar para cumplir su principal objetivo que es hacer crecer su negocio y posicionarlo para que sea más rentable y le dé la oportunidad de tener una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: At 19, Ketty lives with her common law partner and has no children.  Due to lack of work experience and opportunities, it has been hard for her to find a job, reason why she decided to find other options to progress on her own and she opened a small school and office supplies store three years ago, she started with some family savings, her work starts very early in the morning, to take advantage of school schedules, which allow her to attract more customers.  Ketty is energetic, hardworking and with her entrepreneurial vision she is always looking for options that allow her to get ahead, this is why she requests a loan to invest in buying merchandise (paper, pens, markers, adhesive tape, paint and other products) with the purpose of continuing with her business and having stock available to fulfill the needs of her customers in a timely manner, this will allow Ketty to move forward to achieve her main goal which is to grow her business and make it more profitable so that it gives her economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy paper, pens, markers, tape, paint and other products.

loans.name: Evelyn Scarlet

texts.es: Evelyn Scarlet mayor de edad soltera con dos  hijo menores  de edad de unos de los municipios de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país. Evelyn es una microempresaria la cual posee varias actividades ubicadas en su casa de habitación como: venta de mercadería en general, venta de gaseosas y golosinas también da el servicio de juegos de nintendos, sus compras las realiza en mercados de mayoreos otras las realiza fuera del país sus ventas son al contado y al crédito y su servicio de nintendo son al contado, posee clientes fijos y eventuales ella desde muy temprano comienza su labor de trabajo brindándoles excelentes servicios a  sus clientes, Evelyn se caracteriza por ser una mujer con grandes deseos de superación para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo, uno de sus sueños es de ver formados profesionalmente a sus dos hijos y ver terminada su casa de habitación para así brindarles un techo digno donde vivir, el objetivo de este crédito es para compra de activo fijo ya que ella necesita actualizar los equipos y comprar dos consolas Xbox de 360 así también televisores y surtir su inventario de mercadería en general, Evelyn agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Evelyn Scarlet is a single mother of two young children and lives in the Chinandega area in the western part of Nicaragua. She runs small businesses out of her home, selling general supplies, soft drinks and snacks and offering video-game services. She makes her purchases at wholesale markets or outside of the country, and her sales are on cash and credit, while the video-game service is with cash down. She has regular and occasional customers. Evelyn starts working very early, providing excellent services to her customers. She is known as a woman with big dreams to move up in life and make headway for her children. Some of her dreams are to see her children become professionals and to finish construction of her home so she can give them a dignified place to live. She plans to use the loan to purchase two Xbox 360s as well as televisions and to stock up on general supplies for her store. Evelyn is very grateful for the support Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn runs a general retail store in the village of Panduma, Tukuran where she lives with her family. She also buys charcoal and sells it in the market. Her husband works as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) and of the money she receives, she uses a portion of it for her business. She has been doing this for more than five years to make a living. Recently, she borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to buy more charcoal and grocery items to sell. She hopes that in the future, she would be able to have business expansion and provide her family a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 45 years old. She is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has six children. Ligaya manages a gardening business for a living. She helps her husband manage their own farm of rice for it is the main source of income of the family. 

In 2011, Ligaya joined GDMPC. Recently, she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm fertilizers. Ligaya hopes to increase farm production now and in subsequent cycles of production in order to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Age 47 and a villager from Takeo province’s Samrong district, Chea is a widowed mother of five children. She depends solely on her rice cultivation business, which she has occupied for ages and has earned her about 23,000 KHR per day. 

Chea has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She now leads a group of three to take out a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a proper latrine for her family. She expects to own a decent latrine to improve sanitation for her family.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine for family

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Grace has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. Grace requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more seafood to sell to customers.

Grace has been in this business for three years. In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ann Maa Dakhineswari Self Help Group

texts.en:
Ann Maa Dakhineswari Self Help Group is an exemplary group. They all are engaged in different activities to earn their livelihood. Some of them are engaged in agricultural activities, some are running a grocery shop, some sell vegetables, and some have a wood business.

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Basanti, a 40-year-old married woman with three children, who is engaged in cultivating vegetables and selling them in the market. Through her job, she works to support her family, to improve her business and to continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing.
