Ocupará el préstamo en comprar telas para hacer cortinas ya que tiene muchas clientas que le han solicitado cortinas, así que tiene asegurada la compra de éstas, por lo cual sabe que le irá muy bien. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que toda la comunidad se ayuda para salir adelante, y todo su grupo tiene ganas de surgir.
texts.en: Leyla, who can be seen laughing at the back left of the photo, belongs to the communal bank "Punahuel," which is located in Castro, a commune of the Chiloé Province in the Los Lagos Region. In this communal bank, the members sell used clothing and they make food to sell at fairs. Leyla has a sewing workshop that she began many years ago--in fact which she had for almost her entire life--considering that she learned from her mother who also used to sew. Leyla also began machine sewing when she won a sewing machine in a competition. She will use this loan to buy fabric to sew curtains since many customers have asked her for them, and having their purchase assured, she knows that this will go very well for her. What she has liked most about working with Fondo Esperanza is that the entire community helps each other to move forward and that the whole group has a desire to emerge and develop.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sew curtains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel the outside of her house

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Rosa se dedica a la venta de comidas y refrescos por las mañanas en un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad.
Se inició hace más de 5 años, por iniciativa y capital propio. Hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su hermana con quien comparte las ganancias. Decidió a empezar con su negocio por el deseo de tener sus propios ingresos y apoyar su familia económicamente. Su proyecto corriente es ahorrar su dinero para algún día abrir una tienda. Pero por ahorita se dedica a su venta de comidas y refrescos. Esto es su segundo préstamo con Kiva. Está agradecida y contenta de saber que contara con un apoyo financiero para realizar sus planes. Por eso se compromete a  cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto de S./ 1000,  invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35, married, and lives in her family's home with her husband and two children. Rosa sells food and drinks in the morning from a stand in a city market. 

Rosa started the business over five years ago, on her own initiative and with her own funds. Rosa's sister has been supporting the business until now and Rosa shares the stand's income with her. Rosa decided to start her own business because of her desire to have her own income and support her family. She is currently saving money to one day open a store, and right now is dedicated to the sale of meals and drinks.

This is Rosa's second loan with Kiva. She is happy and grateful to know that she can rely on financial support to fulfill her plans. Rosa is therefore committed to making timely payments, as she has for previous loans. Rosa will invest the 1,000 soles in the purchase of ingredients she needs to prepare the dishes she sells, such as rice, sugar, oils, and others.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice and oils to prepare foods to sell.

loans.name: Celene María

texts.es: Celene, con 38 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la actividad comercial, ya que tiene una farmacia ubicada en el sector donde reside; esta actividad la aprendió trabajando con su padre, quien se ha dedicado a este oficio durante mucho tiempo. La prestataria es una mujer luchadora, juiciosa, activa y siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por esta razón solicita el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (jarabes, medicamentos en tabletas, productos de aseo personal) con el fin de continuar con su negocio y tener variedad de productos y marcas para ofrecerle a sus clientes; esto le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y por ende tendrá mayores ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su casa, además podrá tener más posibilidades para cumplir el sueño de hacer crecer su negocio y brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras personas. Así mejorará su calidad de vida y podrá ofrecer a sus padres un mejor bienestar y estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Celene is 38 years old, single, and has no children. She has been a businessperson for 15 years as she has a pharmacy located in the area where she lives. She learned this business working with her father who has followed this occupation for a long time. 

The borrower is a determined, sensible, energetic woman, always looking for options that will allow her to move forward in life. For this reason, she is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of stock (syrups, medicines in tablet form, personal hygiene products) with the aim of continuing with her business and having a variety of products and brands to offer her customers. This will allow her to increase her sales and thereby have greater income to continue contributing to the household finances. In addition, she will be able to have a greater chance of fulfilling her dream of seeing her business grow and offering work opportunities to other people. This way she will improve her quality of life and be able to offer her parents greater well-being and financial stability.

loans.use: To buy stock (syrups, medicines in tablet form, personal hygiene products).

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, who lives in Kilifi, Kenya, is married and blessed with two children. She sells charcoal, and her major challenge is weather. The rainy season causes charcoal prices to rise, hence cutting into her profits.

Margaret learned of Milango through friends, and she is now requesting her second loan to buy ten bags of charcoal. She will reinvest the extra resulting income into the business, and hopes to start other enterprises to diversfify her income.

loans.use: To buy an additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for the livestock business.

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR NAZARENO” esta conformado por 07 socios quienes se encuentran muy contentos por encontrarse pasando al 10 ciclo. Victoria tiene 58 años.  hace 30 años implemento una bodega  en su vivienda. En donde ofrece verduras, tuberculos. Abarrotes, frutas y bebidas. años atrás trabajaba como domestica. El prestamo lo invertira en la compra de frutas, gaseosas y confiteria. Su amyor deseo es mejorar su vivienda. El grupo agardece a los inversionistas KIVA por el prestamo brinado. Victoria es la tercera  del aldo derecho viste falda negra.
texts.en:
The group “Señor Nazareno” consists of seven members who are very pleased to have reached their 10th loan cycle.

Victoria is 58 years old and has been managing a store for 30 years in her home where she offers vegetables, groceries, fruits, and beverages. She previously worked as a domestic employee. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of fruits, sodas, and candy. Victoria’s greatest wish is to improve her home.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that has been provided. Victoria is seated in the third position and is wearing a black skirt.

loans.use: to buy fruits, sodas, and candy.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is widowed with four children, and none go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She sells fruits and vegetables on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 30 years. She gets additional income from frying chapatti. She works seven days a week. 

Janet has requested 200,000 shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy Irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, pineapples and watermelon. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, pineapples and watermelon.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Rosario Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO ROSARIO 
la señora Mirna Susana quien tiene 37 años de edad, lleva vendiendo 3 años en su negocio la cual es una venta de pantalones de lona, blusas de tela, chumpas, zapatos de catalogo,Y cosméticos en general como cremas, desodorantes, colonias, champo para dama y caballero, también hace cortes de pelo y es una señora muy trabajadora.  Últimamente le han hecho muchos pedidos de pantalones de lona de todas tallas y colores y también blusas en diferentes estilos y cosmeticos pero el capital que tiene no le es suficiente para comprar lo que le están pidiendo y necesita nuevamente hacer la solicitud de otro crédito para no perder a los clientes que siempre la visitan para comprar la ropa que necesitan, les agradese por la ayuda brindada y que Dios los bendiga en donde quiera que esten.
texts.en:
Dúo Solidario Rosario [Solidary Rosary Duo]

Mrs. Mirna Susana, who is 37 years old, has had her current business for 3 years. She sells jeans, blouses, jackets, catalogue shoes, and cosmetics in general, such as creams, deodorant, perfume, and shampoo for men and women. She also cuts hair and is a very hard working lady.

She has recently received many orders for jeans of all sizes and colours, as well as blouses in different styles and cosmetics, but she does not have the capital to buy what has been requested, and therefore once again needs a loan to avoid losing her customers who always go to her to buy the clothes they need. She thanks you for the help given and hopes that God blesses you wherever you are.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, men and women's clothes for sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married with four children, and three go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 30 years. She gets additional income from selling piped water and rental houses. She works seven days a week. 

Stella has requested 300,000 shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges are charcoal dust that affects the eyes, and also transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication for her sick eye and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en: Mamuka is 48 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, Ketevan, and his three children (four, six and seven years old) in the capital city of Georgia. Ketevan stays at home and looks after her children. Mamuka was working as a driver, but nowadays he is unemployed. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live in poverty.  Because of the above-mentioned situation, Mamuka lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require a stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Mamuka to get a loan of $3,000 to pay a toll for his truck. Once the toll is paid, he will be able to get orders to transport cargo and generate income.  With support of the Start Up program, Mamuka will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to pay a toll for his truck

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha, de 45 años de edad, esta  casada con Julio quien se dedica al transporte. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. Mirtha se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada como ropas, carteras, peluches, adornos y otros,  además de productos de belleza como esmaltes, cremas faciales, perfumes y otros. Todos estos productos son comprados por catálogos para ser vendidos desde su casa entre sus vecinas y amistades. 
Se inició hace más de 10 años contando con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros. Comenta que decidió empezar con este negocio propio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y contar con ingresos económicos, además de contar con un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva.Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 4000 nuevos soles comprará mercadería como productos de belleza, productos comestibles y regalos por fiestas navideñas y año nuevo  para así aumentar su stock, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras, de esa manera obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 45 years old. She is married to Julio who works in transportation. They live comfortably in their own house. Mirtha sells a variety of products, such as clothes, wallets, stuffed animals and costume jewelry, as well as items such as nail polish, beauty creams and perfume. She buys these products from catalogs, then sells them from her house to her friends and neighbors. 
She started this business over 10 years ago with her own capital, derived from her savings. She says that she decided to start her own business to help her husband with household expenses and to have income, in addition to having a job and feeling productive. This is her third Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she receives, which helps her get ahead; she also commits to paying her fees on time. With the 4000 soles she has just requested, she will be able to purchase merchandise such as beauty products, foodstuffs and gifts for Christmas and New Year parties, which will allow her to increase her stock. She will try to obtain good deals so that she can get better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as beauty products, foodstuffs and gifts for Christmas parties.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin es divorciado y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son todos independientes, vive en casa familiar ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa se encuentra ubicada en La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chófer y a veces hasta muy altas horas de la noche ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
Fermin necesita crédito para mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Fermín is divorced and has three adult children.  He lives in two small rooms in the family house in La Paz.

Currently he works as a driver and sometimes until very late at night.  With what little he earns he has to cover expenses for food and pay for basic services.

Fermín needs a loan to maintain his vehicle because it's his only source of income.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 49-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. For two years now, he has been operating a retail store to supplement his farming and motorcycle transport businesses. Like most traders, he faces a challenge of customers not paying on time. His dream is to expand to new markets. Francis intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread and cloth for a sofa cover manufacturing business.

loans.name: Mikayel

texts.en:
Mikayel was born in and for many years has lived in Yervevan. After graduating from school, he went to the Russian Federation to work abroad. Saving some money, Mikayel decided to return but this time he landed in the village of Bekhi, which is in the Syunik region. Herem living completely alone, Mikayel seriously became engaged in farming. Despite his young age and living alone, Mikayel breeds 25 sheep and 15 goats. Mikayel manages to sell sheep and goat milk, which he milks by himself very handily and easily.

He used his first Kiva loan to buy fodder for his farm animals. Now he is asking for a loan of 700,000 AMD to buy eight milch (dairy) sheep and a lot of animal fodder, since he is seriously thinking of enlarging his farm and become very famous for his sheep and goat milk production.

loans.use: to buy sheep and animal fodder

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 49-year-old married woman with two children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a restaurant and with the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and build a house. The high cost of rent and staff turnover are her major challenges while her dreams are to own a hotel and educate her children up to the University level. Margret intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ayesiga

texts.en: Ayesiga is a 38-year-old Ugandan who is married with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in the sale of produce from agriculture and he has a side business operating a mobile money transfer services. He hopes to build a good residential house for his family, educate his children and own a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year long. Ayesiga is requesting a loan to buy sacks of cassava, maize and peas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cassava, maize and peas to sell.

loans.name: Floria

texts.es: Floria, tiene la edad  de 56 años, está casada,  vive con su hija y esposo, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y materiales y pagar mano de obra en la reparación a la vivienda, y de esta manera eliminar algunas entradas de agua a la vivienda en el periodo de lluvia que ya esta iniciando y así poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su mamá mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Floria is 56 years old. She is married and lives with her daughter and husband, who are her main priorities. With this loan, she hopes to purchase wood, materials and labor to make house repairs, in order to stop water from flooding the home during the rainy season that is about to start. This will enable her to offer a better quality of life to her family. With this purchase, she hopes to make high quality repairs to her house and to improve her mother's quality of life; she also hopes to take advantage of the current low prices of some high quality materials. This will be the first loan she will receive from FUDECOSUR. She had not had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR is granting her this loan, which has good terms and low interest rates.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 29-year-old hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is engaged in a cattle-rearing business, which he started with a goal of earning a better living. With the proceeds, he has managed to buy himself a piece of land and has hopes of completing his house, despite challenges of inadequate capital. 

David is requesting a loan to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas used the previous loan to buy local brew to sell. He is a 27-year-old married man with two children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a local brew business and has been in business for five years. In order to earn extra income, he decided to venture into a produce business, using the savings from the local brew business. He dreams of building a permanent house for his family and buying a vehicle in the future, despite inadequate capital, which affects his business growth. Nicholas intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Kapan, which is in Syunik region. She is divorced and she took care of her son by herself. 

Today, Ruzanna is a very prosperous businesswoman. She owns a small beauty salon where she works with her son. She is a manager of that beauty salon and her son works there as a hairdresser. Ruzanna’s son is a very kind and clever young man and this is the result of his mother’s strict, but full of love upbringing. 

At the same time, Ruzanna is engaged in a clothes-trading business at a rented stall in their city, Kapan. She sells a large variety of women's clothes, which she brings from Yerevan, once in a month, with her son. Today, Ruzanna is very proud of her son since she is sure that, with great efforts and numerous difficulties, she has managed to bring up an honest and kind person and very soon she can trust him fully with all her business.

Ruzanna asks a loan of AMD 1,000,000 (Armenian Drams) since she needs to buy a lot of seasonal clothes for her stall and she also plans to do some repairing to improve the interior of her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a lot of seasonal clothes for her stall and to do some repairing works and improve the interior of her beauty salon

loans.name: Norma Filomena

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Tiempo atrás, una vecina la involucró en la venta de productos de la línea Yanbal, donde se ha mantenido hasta ahora con ventas muy buenas.  Gracias a esta actividad, pudo terminar de estudiar en un curso de enfermería que había tomado.  Labora mayormente durante la tarde, dado que durante la mañana realiza sus tareas de enfermería.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como obrero en las minas.  Ahora, necesita el dinero para invertirlo en la compra de bisutería, perfumes y cremas.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala. Some time ago, a neighbor got her involved in selling products from the Yanbal line. She kept at it and now generates very good sales. Thanks to her business, she was able to finish a course in nursing. The borrower works mostly in the afternoons since she has nursing duties in the mornings. She is married and her husband works as a miner.

At the moment, the borrower needs a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of trinkets, perfumes, and crèmes.

loans.use: to buy trinkets, perfumes, and crèmes.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale, madame Adiza sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Avec un enfant de 08ans en charge, elle désire voir ce dernier s’épanouir et disposer d’une boutique pour étaler ses marchandises. Âgée de 38ans, avec 01 enfant en charge, elle a une ancienneté de 10ans dans l’activité.
texts.en: Adiza is requesting a first loan from WAGES in order to stock up with merchandise and buy general food products.  She supports an 8-year-old child and would like to see her child grow and thrive.  Adiza would also like to have a shop to display her goods.  She is 38 years old, has one child under her care and ten years of experience in her field.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.es: Asteria, de 41 años de edad, está divorciada del padre  de sus 05  hijos de 25, 20 , 16 , 12 y 08 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Asteria se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, todos estos productos los exhibe en una bodega que tiene en su casa, donde atiende muy amablemente  a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Se inició hace más de 05 años gracias a sus ahorros, comprando en pequeñas cantidades y viendo la acogida que tiene su negocio decidió comprar más productos. Le gusta su negocio por el permite estar en contacto con sus clientes y con sus hijos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles comprará productos en general tales como harina, arroz, leche, menestras, entre otros.
texts.en: Asteria, age 41, is divorced from the father of her five children, who are 25, 20, 16, 12 and 8. She lives with her children in her own house. Asteria works selling food products. She displays all of these products in a neighborhood store she operates in her house, where she serves her clients, most of whom are her neighbors, in a very friendly manner. She started more than five years ago thanks to her savings, buying in small quantities. Upon seeing the  response to her business, she decided to buy more products. She likes her business because it allows her to be in contact with her customers and with her children. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives in order to keep going. She is also committed to making her payments in a punctual manner. With the amount requested, 800 Peruvian new soles, she will buy basic products such as flour, rice, milk, beans, etc.

loans.use: to buy products to sell such as flour, rice, milk, beans, etc.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a 30-year-old Ugandan male who is married with two children living in Kagadi. He has served as a teacher for four years alongside carrying out mixed farming as his other source of income. He strives hard to provide the necessary basic needs for his family but suffers a low salary. Denis is requesting a loan to prepare his land for next season and to buy seedlings.

loans.use: to prepare his land for next season and to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 28-year-old Ugandan male who is married with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has served as a primary school teacher for six years with a side income from a piggery project. He works hard to attain both personal and family desires but his project needs funding if he is to reap tangible benefits. Gerald is requesting a loan to support his project by building a modern pigsty.

loans.use: to build a modern pigsty.

loans.name: Los Progresistas Group

texts.es: Este es nuevo grupo “Los Progresistas” está conformado por 08 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar. Este es el caso de Lucinda la cual  se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste casaca roja. Con los deseo es de contar con un negocio propio y de esta manera brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia Lucinda decide aperturar su salón de belleza, la cual brinda cortes de cabello, tintes, tratamiento capilar y peinados. Fruto de su esfuerzo es que ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con el crédito que adquirió comprará tintes, tijeras, esmaltes y así poder darles una mejor atención a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es de comprar su casa ya que por el momento solo lo alquila. Lucinda de 55 años es casada y tiene 05 dependientes. El nuevo grupo “Los Progresistas” agradece el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
This is the new group “Los Progresistas”, which is comprised of eight enthusiastic members who are eager to start working.  This is the case of Lucinda, who is seated in the photograph and wearing a red jacket.

With the aim of having her own business and raising her family's standard of living, Lucinda decided to open a beauty salon.  She cuts and dyes hair and performs other types of hair treatments.  The fruit of her labor is that she has been able to provide a better quality of life for her children. 

With the loan proceeds she will purchase dyes, scissors and nail polish.  This will lead to enhanced service for her customers.  Her main goal is to purchase her own home, since at the moment she only rents one.  She is 55 years old and is married with five dependents.

The new group "Los Progresistas" wishes to express their gratitude for this loan.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, scissors and nail polish.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen de 54 años de edad soltera y con  4 hijos, la Sra. Carmen se dedica ya hace 7 años a la venta de  gaseosas, golosinas en un pequeño puesto todos los días con el fin de salir adelante, la Sra. Carmen nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en una pequeña bodega y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Carmen es la segunda de la mano izquierda se le distingue con  chompa de color rosado, se despide con un abraso a Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en: Carmen is 54 years old. She is single and has 4 children. For seven years now, Carmen has worked selling soft drinks and snacks from a small stand. She does this work every day with the goal of getting ahead in life. Carmen reports that she has been able to attract loyal customers, which has generated income so that she can cover her household expenses. In the future, she would like to have a store of her own where she can sell her products and obtain better earnings. With the loan provided to her, she will invest in a small store and thus have more income. In the photo, Carmen is the second from the left, wearing a pink sweater. She says goodbye "with a hug to Kiva" and would like to tell you that she will achieve all of the goals she has set.

loans.use: to invest in a small store.

loans.name: Argina

texts.en:
Argina lives in the village of Dicmayr in the Syunik region. She is married and has three sons. Argina is a nurse, but she has never worked at her specialty and after getting married, she and her husband engaged in farming. They breed 4 cows and 30 chickens. Argian manages to sell milk, cheese and eggs to the villagers from their house. All this barely covers their family needs and they need to work day by day harder and harder, as their sons are growing up and very soon they will face the expenses of their marriage.  

Argina is asking for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for her all farm animals. She is sure that this support will be on time and very useful.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder

loans.name: Sarapio

texts.en: Sarapio is a Ugandan living in Kagadi. He is 53 years old and married with 13 children. He is a police officer and does farming in order to increase his income and be able to support his family. He joined the police force wanting to serve his country but he is finding life hard because of the low payment for police and the poor working conditions. Despite the challenges he is facing, he hopes to educate his children and complete construction of his house. Sarapio intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets, doors and cement for constructing his residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, doors and cement to constructing his residential  house

loans.name: Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La señora Julia de estado civil unida de hecho, tiene 44 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la ecuela, tiene 8 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales domesticos, inició este negicio por la necesidad de generar un empleo y poder ayudar a su esposo para el sostenimiento de su famiia, a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de pollos y concentrado para los mismos, desea en el futuro tener una granja con gallinas ponedoras. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is 44 years old and in a common-law relationship. She has eight children, two of whom are in school. Julia did not have the opportunity to attend school. She raises domesticated animals. Julia started in this business because she needed a job so that she could help her husband with supporting their family. As of this date, she has five years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who is in the retail trade.

Julia organized a group so that she could request a loan. She will use the money to buy chickens and concentrated feed. In the future, she wants to have a farm with egg-laying hens. The other members of the group engage in trade and raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Florecitas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO FLORECITAS DE VISTA HERMOSA
Este grupo está a cargo de la señora Silveria, quien tiene 60 años de edad, y lleva cuatro años en el negocio de los suéteres de diferentes marcas como el taiwanes, Mexicanos, Nacionales, también vende chumpas y blusas de tela.  Ya se aproxima la feria de Esquipulas, que es el lugar donde ella tiene su negocio.  En esas fechas ella tiene que comprar  muchos suéteres para no quedarles mal a sus clientes cuando lleguen a comprar a su venta.  La mercadería que tiene no es suficiente y tiene que comprar más suéteres en diferentes tallas y colores y también blusas de tela que algunas personas le han pedido.  Por eso necesita dinero para poder comprar pero no le alcanza lo que tiene y se ve en la necesidad de pedir otro crédito y así aprovechar la visita de sus clientes no quedándoles mal.
texts.en:
The group Duo Solidario Florecitas de Vista Hermosa is led by Silveria, who is 60 years old. She has had a business for four years that sells sweaters of different brands from Taiwan, Mexico and Guatemala.  She also sells cloth blouses and jackets.

The Fair of Esquipulas will soon take place in the area where she has her business.  At this time she needs to buy a lot of sweaters so that her customers can get what they want when they come to her shop.  The merchandise that she currently has is not sufficient.  She needs to buy more sweaters in different colors and sizes, as well as cloth blouses that a number of people have ordered.  

She needs capital to make these purchases, but the funds she currently has are not adequate.  Thus, she needs to ask for another loan and thus take advantage of their visits for her shop and lot leave them unsatisfied.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a supply of cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es: Juan es un   joven  de 22 años de edad, y está por culminar la carrera de Mecánico de Maquinaria Pesada. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera  pues siempre le gustó el manejo que los sistemas eléctricos. Actualmente realiza prácticas en una empresa de reparaciones de equipo pesado, gracias a ello puedo solventar sus gastos de sus estudios. Agradece a sus padres pues ellos son  quienes siempre lo motivaron a seguir luchando. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de sus estudios. Terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera es su mayor deseo, pues más adelante piensa formar su empresa de equipo pesado. Está agradecido con el crédito brindado e incentiva apoyar a otros jóvenes como él.
texts.en: Juan is a young man of 22, who is close to finishing his degree as a Heavy Machinery Mechanic. He decided to pursue this career because he has always liked managing electrical systems. Currently, he is doing internship work in a company that repairs heavy equipment. Thanks to this, he has been able to cover the costs of his studies. He is grateful to his parents becasue they are the ones who always motivated him to keep working hard. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for his studies. Successfully finishing his degree is his greatest desire, because in the future he is thinking of starting his own heavy equipment business. He is grateful for the loan provided to him and for the initiative to support other young people such as himself.

loans.use: to pay for his studies.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robinah is a 23-year-old married lady with four children who currently lives in Masindi, Uganda. Her business is to sell fresh food in the market, and she has done this since 2009. 

She has hopes of educating her children to university. However, she is challenged with unpredictable weather changes and stiff competition. 

Robinah will use the loan to buy fresh foods, such as cabbages and beans, to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods, such as cabbages and beans, to sell.

loans.name: Kota Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mr MAHAMADI représente le groupe KOTA WENDE.  Il est célibataire sans enfant. Personne  ne va à l’école. Il n’a personnes en charge. 
Mr  vend des cartes de recharge depuis 03ans. Il s’approvisionne  à kolgnaaba. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter 01lot de cartes pour 500fcca, 01lot de cartes pour 1000fcfa, 01lot de cartes pour 5000fcfa et 01lot de cartes pour 10000fcfa.
Mr  veut épargner ses bénéfices pour son activité. Il  ambitionne agrandir sa société de vente de carte de recharge et  améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mahamadi is the representative of the KOTA WENDE group.  He is single, with no children. He does not support anyone beside himself and does not have school-age children in his care.

Mahamadi has been selling prepaid phone cards for three years.  He buys his goods in Kolgnaaba and resells to both men and women.  He wants to buy one pack of 500 CFA francs cards, one pack of 1,000 CFA francs cards, one pack of 5,000 CFA francs cards and one pack of 10,000 CFA francs cards.

He wants to save his profits and reinvest in his activity.  His ambition is to expand his phone card business and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards.

loans.name: Dúo Camineros De Cristo Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario Camineros de cristo El señor  Guillermo de sesenta y cinco (65) años de edad, es casado y tiene  dos hijos uno que ya está casado y una que todavía está  soltera, desde hace dieciséis (16) años posee su propia tienda que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, él ha mantenido y a sacado adelante a su familia, el sueño de don Guillermo es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamos quiere comprar producto especialmente invertir para la compra de granos basicos de consumo diario y surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
The group "Dúo Solidario Camineros de Cristo" is led by Guillermo, who is 65 years old.  He is married and has two children, one of whom is already married.  For the last 16 years he has had his own shop.  Thanks to his efforts in this, he has been able to establish, maintain and improve his home, and also to provide a better life for his family.

His dream is to improve his family's quality of life with the help of a micro-loan that he is seeking through FAPE.  With the funds he wants to purchase products and especially to invest in basic grains to re-stock his store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains for resale.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a single man aged 26 years and currently supports no one but himself.  He runs a grocery shop in Eldama Ravine and it has been in operation for a period of three years earning him an income of Kes 15,000 monthly.

He is now requesting his third loan of Kes 40,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. He intends to use this amount to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale.  The anticipated amounts he will earn will be used to expand his current business.

His dream is to prosper in his current business and have his own family.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Bogoba 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Bogoba1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Togo, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Adiara (première femme debout à droite dans la photo,) compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Bogoba 1 group are all married in traditional families. They are, on average, 39 years old and have an average of three children each. They all live in the village of Togo in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season and also through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship within the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

In order to buy small tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in their fields, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth cycle of farming loan. 

Adiara (standing first from the right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, as well as small tools from local blacksmiths.  She will also hire young people to weed her field.  

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season, and she uses her earnings to repay her loan, to take care of her children, and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds and farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in her fields.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives with her family in Kapan city which is in Syunik region. She is married and has two sons; the elder is in military service and the second son has just graduated school. Her husband is in the Russian Federation as an overseas worker in order to manage to support his family financially. 

For several years Marine worked at a cooperative as a tailor-worker. After getting married and taking care of her two sons, she decided to establish her own business. In the first floor of their house she became engaged in a pillow dry-cleaning business. In recent years in Armenia this type of pillow cleaning has become very popular and Marine herself has many loyal clients. She has managed to buy a special machine which does all the work connected with cleaning automatically. It is the fastest, neatest and most convenient way of pillow cleaning.

Marine is asking for a 400.000 AMD loan as she needs to buy a lot of textiles for pillow-sewing after the cleaning process. She will be very grateful if Kiva lenders support her since only through their help can her business thrive and make progress.

loans.use: to buy a lot of textiles to use for sewing pillows after the cleaning process

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is divorced and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Agnes is a successful businesswoman. She sells provisions in Emssakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about eight years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Agnes uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Agnes will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Esther is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling rice, beans, and salted fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. 

Esther is married and has five children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esther wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice, beans, and salted fish. In the long term, Esther plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels to sell greater quantities of rice, beans, and salted fish

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. 

Ekua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Dalip

texts.en:
Dalip worked in the buying-selling trade during the communist era up to 1991, when he reached 30 years old. For some time afterwards, his focus shifted to agriculture because it was not that hard for him to pursue such an activity, since he already was “a villager”, according to him. 

Then, nine years back, he opened a bar/café where he could also sell grocery items. From that time on, this has been his primary activity and has proved to be profitable somehow.

Dalip has just turned 52 and is a married father of two children who are still attending school.

The loan Dalip is requesting will be used to stock up on inventory items for his store.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his bar/café and grocery.

loans.name: Bogoba 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Bogoba 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Togo, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame   Afoussatou  (1 ère assise à droite compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Bogoba 2 group are all married within traditional families. They are, on average, 35 years old and they have an average of two children each. They all live in the village of Togo in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season and also through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship within the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.

In order to buy small tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in their fields, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth cycle of farming loan.

Afoussatou (first from the right in the front row) plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, as well as small tools from local blacksmiths. She will also hire young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season, and she uses her earnings to repay her loan, to take care of her children, and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds, farm inputs and to cover the cost of weeding in her fields.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus 02 hijos de 11  y 09 años de edad respectivamente. Luz se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, para eso cuenta con una tienda que instaló en la casa de sus padres, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son su vecinos. Se inició hace más de 03 años con sus ahorros y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Antes de empezar con su actividad, no tenía problemas, pero si los deseos de generase sus propios ingresos y apoyar a su padres con los gastos del hogar. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene deseos de continuar con su negocio e incursionar en otro negocio de venta de ropas, pues ha visto que es bastante rentable. Este es su primer préstamo con kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo económico que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, leche, harina, entre otros.
texts.en: Luz is 28 years old. She is single and lives in her parent's home with her two children who are 11 and 9 years old, respectively. Luz works selling groceries. To do this she has a store that she installed in her parents house where she attends to her customers, the majority of whom are her neighbors, in a very friendly manner. She began this project more than three years ago with her savings and until now she did it all alone. Before she began her business she didn't have problems, but she had the desire to earn her own income and to support her parents with the expenses of their home. Having witnessed the great results that she is achieving, she therefore desires to continue this business and to explore another business selling clothes because she has seen that it is very profitable. This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful to receive economic support that will permit her to get ahead with her business. With the amount she is seeking of 800 nuevos soles ($300) she will buy groceries like rice, milk and flour, among others.

loans.use: to buy groceries like rice, milk and flour, among others.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is divorced. After successfully graduating Form 4, Hannah is now an established businesswoman. She sells eggs and ice 'kenkey' in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Hannah uses her income to provide for the entire family.

 Hannah will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of eggs and maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of eggs and maize

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity sells cloth and shoes in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has been educated until the end of junior high school.  She is married and has five children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Charity has been working in this enterprise for five years now. As the sole provider in the family, she is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her cloth and shoes enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of cloth and shoes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She sells 'etsew' (a type of fermented maize dough) in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began four years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. 

Ama has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more 'etsew' to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more 'etsew' (a type of 'kenkey') to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grill for booking and tarpaulin for the metal structure

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Yaa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough, wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for four years. 

Yaa is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Yaa wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, Yaa plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy supplies for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Margaret is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fruit in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Margaret is married and has 2 children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. Margaret wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fruit. In the long term, Margaret plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fruit.

loans.name: Maria Mirian

texts.es: María, de 39 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. María ha decidido establecer su propio negocio para generar ingresos para su hogar, hace años y medio inicio vendiendo pollo frito con tajadas, baleadas(tortilla de harina rellena con frijoles, queso, crema huevo etc.),tacos, pastelitos, agua, dulces, churros y refrescos. el préstamo que ha solicitado para surtir de golosinas y comprar insumos para vender comida, es por 3,500 Lempiras. con este préstamo va ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. su plan es poder darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos y hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en: María is 39 years old, is married and lives with her husband and her two children in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. María decided to start her own business to generate income for her home.  A year and a half has passed since she began selling fried chicken with sliced plantains, baleadas (flour tortillas filled with beans, cheese, fried eggs, etc.), tacos, small cakes, water, sweets, churros and drinks. The loan she is seeking is to purchase a supply of candies and to buy necessities for her food sales. With this loan she will offer a variety of products to her customers. Her plan is to provide a better future to her children and to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy candies and supplies (meats, flour, butter, condiments, beans, etc.) to make food to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 7 years. As a widow with 4 children, Esi uses all her income to provide for herself and her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales.

loans.name: Agnes Aba

texts.en:
Agnes Aba is a small scale African clothing and shoe vendor in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a middle school graduate. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is currently on pension. 

Agnes Aba  has been working as a African clothing and shoe vendor for close to 20 years. As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of African clothing and shoes, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise in the future to fulfill her dream of mounting a clothing and shoe stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of African clothing and shoes, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Even though Abena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Abena is an entrepreneur. She sells fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 4 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 6 children. 

Abena has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare her tasty local dishes

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells fried fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about seven years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of  fish

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Even though Cecilia grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Cecilia is an entrepreneur. She sells fish in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 10 years ago.

Cecilia uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children. Cecilia has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Bogoba 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes de Bogoba 3 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Togo, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Sitan (première femme debout au bout à gauche avec une assiette de graines d’arachide en main dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Togo.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The eight women who make up the Bogoba 3 group are all married within traditional families. They are, on average, 36 years old and they have an average of two children each. They all live in the village of Togo in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season and also through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship within the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.

In order to buy small tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in their fields, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth cycle of farming loan.

Sitan, a member of the group, is an important farm work leader during the rainy season in the village of Togo.  In the photo she is the woman standing first from the left and holding a plate of groundnut seeds.  She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, as well as small tools from local blacksmiths. She will also hire young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season, and she uses her earnings to repay her loan, to take care of her children, and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds, farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in her fields.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Las Gaviotas De Ciudad Vieja Group

texts.es: DUO SOLIDARIO LAS GABIOTAS está conformado por doña Aura Angélica  quien tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 4 hijas ella solicita su crédito para poder invertir y comprar en  ropa (calcetines, toallas, ropa interior, calcetas) y utensilios de cocina (tasas, ollas, platos, vasos etc.) en su tienda  o(miscelánea ya que vende regalos, ropa de vestir, ropa interior, granos de consumo diario etc.) ya que ella tiene una gran demanda porque tiene variedad de productos espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que seria de mucha ayuda para ella y su negocio.
texts.en:
Aura Angélica is a member of the "Duo Solidario Las Gaviotas" group. She is 42 years old and has four daughters. She is applying for a loan so that she can purchase clothing (socks, towels, underwear) and kitchen utensils (cups, bowls, plates, glasses etc.) in her store, or miscellaneous goods, as she sells gifts, clothing, underwear, staple grains, etc. 

She has a great deal of demand because she has a variety of products. She hopes they will be able to help her with the loan applied for, as it would be a great help for her and her business.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina operates a ‘Kenkey’ selling business (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She prepares the ‘Kenkey’ on her own and subsequently sells it in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). Philomina is a divorcee with 3 children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Philomina uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, Philomina understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy working tools.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling saucepans in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Ama is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees.

Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater numbers of saucepans. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater numbers of saucepans.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Zenabu decided to set up her own seamstress business in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). With over 27 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more sewing supplies. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a trader) with the upkeep of their house while also ensuring that their 3 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling secondhand clothes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Ama is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and topay their children’s school fees. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of secondhand clothes, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Djekafo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Djekafo 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Togo, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame   Alimata  la première femme assise droite  est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Togo. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Djekafo 1 group are all married within traditional families. They are, on average, 40 years old and they have an average of three children each. They all live in the village of Togo in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season and also through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship within the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.

In order to buy small tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in their fields, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth cycle of farming loan.

Alimata, a member of the group, is an important farm work leader during the rainy season in the village of Togo. In the photo she is in the front row, first from the right. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, as well as small tools from local blacksmiths. She will also hire young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season, and she uses her earnings to repay her loan, to take care of her children, and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds, farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in her fields.

loans.name: Jacqueline Abigail

texts.es: Jacqueline de 20 años de edad habita junto a su hijo de 6 meses. Es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora dispuesta a dar lo mejor de si por su hijo. Jacqueline se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante como pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas entre otros, por su manera atenta y amable se ha hecho de clientes quienes la prefieren y le compran con preferencias esta es su única fuente fija de ingresos. Ella desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda es por eso que solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo y comprar laminas, clavos y polines entre otros. Así ella y su hijo podrán estar felices a no tener ya más goteras en su humilde casa.
texts.en: Jacqueline is 20 years old. She lives with her 6 month old son. She is a hardworking fighter who gives the best for her child. Jacqueline works selling clothes as a street vendor, selling pants, skirts, shirts, blouses and more. Because of her attentive and friendly manner she has gained customers who prefer her and buy from her. This is her only regular source of income. She wants to improve the roof on her home. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy metal sheeting, nails, rods and more. This way, she and her son will be happy not to have any more leaks in the house.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, rods, cement, gravel, sand and more.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 40 años de edad habita junto a su familia su esposa que es ama de casa y sus hijos de; 13 años, 11 años, 3 años, un bebecito de 15 meses de edad. Es un hombre muy entregado al trabajo ya que es el único responsable de llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, se caracteriza por ser muy emprendedor y atento a sus actividades. Actualmente Samuel se dedica a realizar estructuras metálicas, es muy conocido en su lugar de vivienda por realizar buenos trabajos y con orden ya que todo lo que hace lo trata de entregar sin errores y sin problemas. Su mayor sueño en este momento es tener su casa en buen estado ya que sus hijos están pequeños y es el único patrimonio que les entregará es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamos para cambiar el material de techo, comprar lámina galvanizada, polines y otros materiales. Samuel dice que al realizar ésta mejora a su vivienda se sentirá muy contento ya que sus hijos se sentirán muy a gusto y seguros dentro su casa.
texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old and lives with his wife, who is a homemaker, their little 15-month-old baby, and their other children aged 3, 11 and 13.

He is very dedicated to his work since he is solely responsible for providing daily sustenance to his household.  He is very enterprising and attentive to his activities.  Currently he builds metal structures, and he his well-known in his area for the good work that he does and his precision.  In everything he does he tries to avoid any errors or problems.

His greatest dream at the moment is to get his house into good shape, since his children are small, and this home is all he can give them.  For this reason he is seeking a loan through FUSAI so that he can replace his roof.  He will buy galvanized material, wooden beams and other materials.  Samuel says that when he makes this upgrade to his house he will feel very content, since his children will feel happier and safer in their home.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheeting for his roof, as well as steel, concrete or other items.

loans.name: Yesica Beatriz

texts.es: Yesica de 25 años de edad habita junto a su madre que es su mayor fuente de inspiración y admiración. Ellas viven en casa propia, su madre trabajó con esfuerzo y dedicación y ahora ella desea darle agradecimiento con mejorarle su vivienda cambiándole el piso y el techo, con el tiempo de uso se mantiene en mal estado y por las lluvias y los fuertes vientos que ha sufrido en estos últimos años el techo no soporta más, es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de: cemento, hierro, laminas, ladrillos entre otros. Yesica tiene el oficio de cosmetóloga, posee una abundante clientela quien la busca pues es la única que tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en la zona donde reside es esto su respaldo para saldar la deuda que pronto adquirirá.  Desea pronto cumplir con el sueño de su madre y otorgarle una casa limpia y bonita.
texts.en: Yesica is 25. She lives with her mother, who is her main source of inspiration and admiration. They live in their own home. Her mother worked with dedication and now she wants to thank her by improving her home with a new roof an floor. Over time is had fallen into bad repair and because of the rain and strong wind they have had in the last few years, it can't take anymore. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy the cement, iron bars, sheeting, bricks and more. Yesica works as a cosmetologist. She has a lot of customers who seek her out because she is the only one who has a little beauty parlor in the area where she lives. This is her guarantee for the loan she will take out soon. Soon, she wants to make her mother's dream come true and give her a clean and pretty house.

loans.use: to buy: cement, iron rods, and galvanized sheeting for the roof, bricks and more.

loans.name: Rosario Guadalupe

texts.es: Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia, vive con su esposo (que trabaja como albañil) y sus 6 hijos que aún son menores de edad. Siempre, dice Rosario, que sus hijos han sido son toda su vida y por lo cual está dispuesta a luchar en la vida por ellos.  Ella es muy servicial, honesta y responsable con su trabajo y su hogar. Rosario Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de Tamales, que es una comida típica hecha de maíz y relleno de pollo acompañado con otros ingredientes. Ella los elabora por la mañana y los vende en la tarde, en una zona muy transitada de la ciudad. Rosario Guadalupe solicitó un préstamo a FUSAI para reparar el techo de su casa y hacer una pared de tapial al frente de su vivienda. Su esposo la ayudará con la mano de obra y con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá los materiales de construcción; cemento, ladrillo de barro, arena, grava y otros.
texts.en:
Rosario is a hardworking woman who always struggles to offer the best for her family. She lives with her husband (who works as a bricklayer) and six children, who are still all minors. Rosario states that it is her children who are her life and it is for them that she is ready to fight. She is very helpful, honest and responsible in her work and at home. Rosario Guadalupe sells tamales, a traditional food made from corn, filled with chicken and other ingredients. She makes them in the morning and sells them in a very busy part of the city in the afternoon. 

Rosario Guadalupe is requesting a loan from FUSAI to repair the roof of her house and to build an adobe wall in front of the house. Her husband will supply the labor and the money from the loan will be used to purchase the construction materials; cement, clay bricks, sand, gravel etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and roofing.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante, ella tiene 48 años edad y tiene tres hijos, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de condimentos, granos secos, papa, cereales entonces envía sus productos a uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad del Cusco y le va muy bien entonces en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos secos como por ejemplo cebada,  maíz y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Manuela is a working mother and entrepreneur who gets ahead. She is 48 years old and has three children. 

She has a small business buying and selling spices, dry grains, potatoes, and cereals. She sends the products to one of the popular markets of Cusco, and does very well. At this time, she needs the loan to buy more dry grains like barley and corn, and other things. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Virgen del Rosario" [Virgin of the Rosary]. She appreciates and values the loan, and promises to comply with the payment of monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy more dry grains, such as barley and corn, and other things

loans.name: Celfa Ondina

texts.es: Celfa de 34 años de edad habita junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos actualmente estudiando.  Tiene ya 12 años de habitar en su hogar gracias a Dios es propia, pero su vivienda tiene variar reparaciones pendientes, necesita repara el techo, reparar el encementado de piso, las que quisiera hacer ya que no ha tenido los recursos necesarios para efectuarlas. Su mayor ilusión es tener su casa bien arreglada y sin mayores defectos pues los inviernos se aproximan y esto solo hará que su casa se mantenga en mal estado.
