Celfa es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que toda su vida la ha dedicado hacer comerciante. Actualmente tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, también se dedica a planchar ropa para otras familias, los fines de semana vende pasteles que es un plato típico hecho de maíz y relleno con carne molida y verduras. Así es como ella se gana la vida honradamente y vence todas las adversidades que la vida le presenta. Celfa solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar la lámina galvanizada, clavos y pines para reparar el techo, también adquirirá el cemento, arena y grava para reparar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Celfa is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are studying. They have lived in their own home for 12 years now,  thank the Lord, but the house needs a variety of repairs. They need to fix the roof and the cement flooring, which they would have liked to have finished by now, but did not have the necessary resources to do it. Their biggest dream is to have their house in good condition with no major problems as winter is coming and winter is hard on the house. 

Celfa is a hardworking woman and a fighter who has been in business all her life. Now she operates a small store where she sells basic necessities. She also does laundry for other families and on weekends she sells traditional pies made out of corn and filled with ground meat and vegetables. In this way she makes an honorable living and overcomes all the setbacks life presents her.

Celfa is requesting a loan from FUSAI which will be used to buy galvanized sheeting, nails and wood to repair the roof, and also buy cement, sand and gravel to repair the floor of their home.

loans.use: to repair the roof and fix the floor, buy sheeting, sand and cement.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has 8 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves, for a living. She normally sells her kenkey in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 2 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more maize, which will allow her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, allowing her to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more maize so that she can improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar lives in the suburb of the capital city, Tbilisi. He is 34 and lives with his wife and three children. Otar installs parquet floors and earns a monthly income. He works on special orders and is the only one earning money in his household. As the income is not enough to cover every day expenses, Otar has decided to start a new business, but he found that he did not have enough money to do so. Therefore, he needed some credit to implement his plan.

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to the vulnerable poor who,  regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income, do not have access to credit products. With this credit, Otar will purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city. Otar is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his children with a good education so that they can progress in live.  This credit will be a great support for his family. Otar is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him the chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Isuf

texts.en:
Isuf, 53, is married and has no children. His wife is a housewife. For more than 3 years now, Isuf has been providing transportation taxi services for others as the only source of income for his family. He has been a KosInvest client for many years and has used KosInvest loans to improve his business and his family’s lifestyle. 

Now, he is requesting a loan to repair his taxi and renovate his garage. Isuf also hopes to increase the number of vehicles in his fleet to provide better transport services to his passengers. His business is Isuf's only means of supporting his family and he hopes to stay in good health and to keep making his own living in order not to have to ask for help from others. He is very happy for this support!

loans.use: to repair his taxi and renovate his garage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad es madre soltera, vive junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad y su madre de 65 años de edad. Es una mujer con buenos principios y siempre se caracteriza por entregarle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo y querida madre. María se dedica a la labor de domestica y además trabaja en un comedor en donde se siente muy orgullosa por su trabajo. Su mayor deseos en este momento de su vida es mejorar su vivienda, ya que es lo único que tiene para  su hijo, es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo y poder mejorar el área de cocina, compra de laminas y polines para reparar el techo de su casa. Está agradecida con FUSAI ya que han confiado en ella, por lo que hará todo lo posible para no fallar en su pago.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old. She is a single mother. She lives with her child who is 12 years old and her mother who is 65 years old. She is a woman of good principles and is known to always give the best to her young child and beloved mother. María is a domestic worker. She also works in a restaurant. She is very proud of the work she does there. 

At this time of her life her greatest dream is to improve her home, which is the only thing she can pass on to her child. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, so that she can improve the kitchen area. She wants to buy sheet metal and wooden beams to repair the roof of the house. She is grateful to FUSAI who have put their faith in her, and she will do everything possible not to miss any payments.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to the kitchen area, buying sheet metal and wooden beams to improve her home

loans.name: Pandora

texts.en:
People in the village where Pandora resides have been commenting on her being happy almost all the time and also on her personality. Here is what some of her neighbors said: “It’s really a blessing having her live next to you. She has this good energy that she sends to you as soon as you meet with her. It’s just awesome. And your day goes just smooth afterwards.”

Pandora lives in a little town in the southeastern part of the country, but despite the fact that she lives in a town, she runs an agricultural activity in her village.

“I live in the town because my kid is still attending high school, and we lack such a school in the village. Otherwise, we would live in the village, because in my heart, I will always remain that ‘villager’,” she said, sighing. 	

With this loan, Pandora would like to buy agricultural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fried fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Efua is married and has three children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fried fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fried fish

loans.name: Ilir

texts.en:
Ilir is 42 years old. He is married, and lives with his wife and two children in a western part of Kosovo. 

Two years ago, he opened a car wash to earn a living and provide for his family. The car wash is in a location that has a lot of traffic and people passing though, providing him with many customers and exposure to the public. His business is one of the better known ones in their town because of the good service that he provides to his customers. 

Many of his customers comment that it is precisely his level of customer service and very hard work that brings them back to this car wash. 

Ilir is requesting a loan to purchase a car washing machine and pay for renovation to his car wash. 

In the future, he wants to increase the capacity of his business, so he can satisfy an even larger amount of clients and meet an increased demand for car washes. 

His goal is to offer a better education to his children. He appreciates this help!

loans.use: To purchase a car washing machine and renovate his car wash

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married with two children. She has received some schooling, through the end of middle school. 

Currently, Ama sells cloth in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about seven years now. Her husband is a driver.

Ama’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Ama will use the loan to increase her existing cloth inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Ama plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing cloth inventory

loans.name: Fenita

texts.en: Fenita is involved in the seamstress business in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a coco seller) support their child. She has been involved as a seamstress for eight years now. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional amounts of sewing material, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her seamstress enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of sewing material

loans.name: Kenny

texts.en:
Kenny is 38 years old. He is a hardworking and humble micro-entrepreneur who owns a Zoona mobile money transfer business in a town called Solwezi where he has just relocated. Kenny is married and has a two-year-old daughter.  His wife and daughter live in a town called Chirundu located in the Southern part of Zambia. Chirundu is a 12-hour drive from Solwezi and Kenny catches a bus every weekend to see his family.

The mobile money transfer business is Kenny’s only source of income. His business deals in the sending and receiving of money from one place to the other. Kenny’s profit is dependent on how many people he is able to serve. 

Kenny is hopeful that once his Kiva loan comes in, he will be able to serve more customers and earn more profits. The profits will help him to settle down in Solwezi and bring his family to live with him. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to have working capital to perform more money transfers

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Abena sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 15 years. As a widow with 8 children, Abena uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Abena will use the loan to purchase more limes, which will help her improve her overall sales. Abena wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more limes, which help her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells oranges in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has been educated through the end of senior high school. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a driver. Margaret has been working in this enterprise for 6 years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels of oranges. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her orange enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of oranges

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is married. She has 4 children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. A Form 4 graduate, Comfort currently sells garden eggs, tin tomatoes, pepper, salt, onions, and spices in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). With over 10 years of experience in this trade, Comfort sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more garden eggs, tin tomatoes, pepper, salt, onion, and spices, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Comfort wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her foodstuff enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more garden eggs, tin tomatoes, pepper, salt, onions, and spices, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a small scale grocery vendor in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a Junior High School graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Rose has been working as a grocery vendor for close to ten years. As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of groceries, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her grocery enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries for her store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married to a driver. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

As a Form 6 graduate, Juliana currently prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She normally sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). With over 5 years of experience in this trade, Juliana sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. However, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her ‘Kenkey’ preparing capacity. 

Juliana's loan will be used to buy more maize, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Juliana wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more maize, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began eight years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Ama has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. However she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Therefore, she aims to use her loan to purchase more limes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more limes to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a small scale charcoal seller in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a Form 4 graduate. She is married and her husband is a mechanic. Grace has been working as a charcoal seller for close to eight years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of charcoal, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a charcoal stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of charcoal to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells groceries in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has been educated up to the end of primary school.  Mary is married and has three children. Her husband is a electrician. 

Mary has been working in this enterprise for a number of years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels of groceries. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her grocery enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of groceries.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has four children. Although she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about six years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
After graduating from middle school, Margaret decided to set up her own fish business in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). 

With over five years worth of experience, she is now looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she her opportunities are limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more fish for resale. 

Margaret aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a GHACEM employee) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is single and has two children. After successfully graduating senior high school, Esther is now an established businesswoman. She works as a hairdresser in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about ten years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esther uses her income to provide for the entire family. Esther will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of hair products, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair products

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has three children. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. 

The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is married to a chainsaw operator, and has three children. A Junior High School graduate, Diana currently sells cassava in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

With over six years of experience selling cassava, Diana sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. However, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. 

Diana wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her cassava enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth grew up in difficult circumstances, and is now an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She prepares the ‘Kenkey’ on her own and then sells it in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 35 years. 

Elizabeth is divorced. She has no children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. 

Elizabeth wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, she plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize to make Kenkey.

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is 40 years old. He operates a butchery and this has been his business for the last three years. He started the business by buying and selling cattle and goats, and with time he built his own butchery and now does everything on his own. 

Mgandi see an opportunity to start a food canteen in the area where he operates the butchery, and so this is what he is targeting. He seeks a loan to buy flour, beans, kale and cooking oil.

Mgandi is family man with five children to take care of. His business is the sole source of income for him and his family. He wants to grow his business to a point where he will be able to win big tenders. The major challenges that he faces in the business include inadequate financing and price changes. The extra income that he will raise will help him pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, kales and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is involved in selling soft drinks in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a driver) support their four children. She has been involved in selling soft drinks for eight years now. 

Yaa plans on using her loan to purchase additional quantities of soft drinks, thus helping her sell more as a result of her increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her soft drink enterprise, and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients in Emissakrom, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Ekua is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels; hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest future profits into her business; thus, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels; hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is married with four children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family have no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Brenda sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years, and she works seven days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Brenda's goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to ease transportation, and to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell at the market.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is divorced and has four children. After successfully graduating from Form 4, Theresa is now an established businesswoman. She sells cassava in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast), and has been actively involved in this business for about 17 years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Theresa uses her income to provide for the entire family. Theresa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education; yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for a number of years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have three children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of limes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of limes
